scenes.location: An office
scenes.description: In the scene, Agent Smith engages in a series of dialogues with Neo, revealing Neo's dual identity and the extent of their knowledge about him.

characters.name: Agent Smith
characters.description: A relentless agent with piercing blue eyes and a professional demeanor.
characters.position: Sitting behind a desk, facing Neo.
characters.states: Calm, confident, with an occasional sarcastic tone.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: A programmer and hacker known as Neo, his expression ranges from confusion to panic.
characters.position: Seated in a chair opposite the desk.
characters.states: Initially confused, he becomes panicked as the conversation unfolds.

actions.action: Agent Smith reveals Neo's dual identity and informs him that he has been under observation for some time.
actions.dialogue: "We know you've been contacted by a man named Morpheus."

actions.action: Neo, upon hearing this information, starts to panic and tries to grasp his situation.
actions.dialogue: "What do you want from me?"

scenes.plot: In this scene, Agent Smith discloses their knowledge of Neo's dual identity and attempts to coerce him into cooperating to capture Morpheus. Neo gradually realizes his predicament and becomes increasingly panicked throughout the dialogue.

chunk.text:
{
    "title": "The Matrix",
    "characters": [
        "Agent Smith",
        "Switch",
        "Apoc",
        "Neo",
        "Cypher",
        "Agent Brown",
        "Choi (as Marc Gray)",
        "Trinity",
        "Oracle",
        "Agent Jones",
        "Mouse",
        "Rhineheart",
        "Dozer",
        "Morpheus",
        "Tank"
    ],
    "dialogues": {
        "Agent": "
[1]			Lieutenant? 
[2]			Lieutenant, you were given 			specific orders --  
[3]			The orders were for your protection. 	The Lieutenant laughs. 
[4]			No, Lieutenant, your men are dead. 
[5]			Did you get anything from the 			room? 
[6]			Their next target. The name is 			Neo. 	The handset of the pay phone lays on the ground, 	separated in the crash like a severed limb. 
[7]			We'll need a search running. 
[8]			It's already begun. 	We are SUCKED TOWARDS the mouthpiece of the phone, CLOSER 	and CLOSER, UNTIL the smooth gray plastic spreads out 	like a horizon and the small HOLES WIDEN until we fall 	through one --  	Swallowed by the darkness that becomes --  	A computer screen. 	We are on-line, inside a chat room called "The Matrix. " 	It is an exklusive web-site where hackers hang out. 
[9]			As you can see, we've had our eye 			on you for some time now, Mr. 			Anderson. 	He opens the file. Paper rattle marks the silence as he 	flips several pages. Neo cannot tell if he is looking at 	the file or at him. 
[10]			It seems that you have been living 			two lives. In one life, you are 			Thomas A. Anderson, program writer 			for a respectable software 			company. You have a social 			security number, you pay your 			taxes and you help your land lady 			carry out her garbage. 	The pages continue to turn. 
[11]			The other life is lived in 			computers where you go by the 			hacker alias Neo, and are guilty 			of virtually every computer crime 			we have a law for, including the 			unauthorized use of the D. M. V. 			system for the removal of 			automobile boots. 	Neo feels himself sinking into a pit of shit. 
[12]			One of these,lives has a future. 			One of them does not. 	He closes the file. 
[13]			I'm going to be as forthcoming as 			I can be, Mr. Anderson. You are 			here because we need your help. 	He removes his sunglasses; his eyes are an unnatural ice- 	blue. 
[14]			We know that you have been 			contacted by a certain individual. 			A man who calls himself Morpheus. 			Whatever you think you know about 			this man is irrelevant to the fact 			that he is wanted for acts of 			terrorism in more countries than 			any other man in the world. He is 			considered by many authorities to 			be the most dangerous man alive. 	He leans closer. 
[15]			My colleagues believe that I am 			wasting my time with you, but I 			believe you want to do the right 			thing. It is obvious that you are 			an intelligent man, Mr. Anderson, 			and that you are interested in the 			future. That is why I believe you 			are ready to put your past 			mistakes behind you and get on 			with your life. 	Neo tries to match his stare. 
[16]			We are willing to wipe the slate 			clean, to give you a fresh start 			and all we are asking in return is 			your cooperation in bringing a 			known terrorist to justice. 	Neo nods to himself. 
[17]			You disappoint me, Mr. Anderson. 
[18]			The irony of your situation is 			that you have no choice. 
[19]			And tell me, Mr. Anderson, what 			good is a phone call iy you are 			unable to speak? 	The question unnerves Neo and strangely, he begins to 	feel the muscles in his jaw tighten. 	The standing agents snicker, watching Neo's confusion 	grow into panic. 	Neo feels his lips grow soft and sticky as they slowly 	seal shut, melding into each other until all trace of his 	mouth is gone. 	Wild with fear, he lunges for the door but the agents 	restrain him holding him in the chair. 
[20]			You are going to help us, Mr. 			Anderson, whether you want to or 			not. 	Smith nods and the other two rip open his shirt. 	From a case taken out of his suit coat, Smith removes a 	long, fiber-optic wire tap. 	Neo struggles helplessly as Smith dangles the wire over 	his exposed abdomen. Horrified, he watches as the 	electronic device animates, become an organic creature 	that resembles a hybrid of an insect and a fluke worm. 	Thin, whisker-like tendrils reach out and probe into 	Neo's navel. He bucks wildly as Smith drops the creature 	which looks for a moment like an uncut umbilical cord --  	Before it begins to burrow its, tail thrashing as it 	worms its way inside. 
[21]			Do we have a deal, Mr. Reagan? 	Cypher chews the steak loudly, smacking it between his 	teeth. 
[22]			Then we have a deal? 
[23]			Whatever you want, Mr. Reagan. 	Cypher takes a deep drink of wine. 
[24]			Access codes to Zion. 
[25]			Morpheus. 
[26]			Eighth floor. They're on the 			eighth floor. 
[27]			Eighth floor! Move! 
[28]			Where are they? 
[29]			Are orders that hard to follow? 			I'll say it again. Morpheus must 			be taken alive. Understand? 
[30]			How like a rodent. 
[31]			We have them now. 
[32]			So, we meet at last. 
[33]			Smith. I am Agent Smith. 
[34]			I've been waiting for this noment. 	Faster than a snake spits, Morpheus cracks Smith with a 	jaw-breaking right. 
[35]			You can't win. 	Morpheus smiles. 
[36]			Take him. 	Cops swarm over Morpheus. 
[37]			The others were lost. 
[38]			You've taken care of Reagan? 	Agent Jones nods. 
[39]			Then the others do not matter. 
[40]			There is a problem. Reagan has 			failed to secure the hardware. 	Agent Smith stares out the window. 
[41]			Never send a human to do a 			machine's job. 
[42]			But if Reagan has failed, why 			haven't they pulled the plug? 
[43]			Haven't you learned by now, that 			it is impossible to understand why 			they do the things they do? 	He turns. 
[44]			Continue as planned. Trace his 			signal to locate their position 			and deploy an extermination unit. 	Morpheus is handcuffed to a chair, stripped to the waist. 	He is bleeding from numerous wounds and is pumped full of 	serum, alternately shivering and sweating. He is hooked 	up to various monitors with white disk electrodes. 	Agent Brown begins running a trace program. 
[45]			Have you ever stood and stared at 			it, Morpheus? Marveled at its 			beauty. Its genius. Billions of 			people just living out their 			lives. . . oblivious. 	Agent Brown sucks a serum from a glass vial, filling a 	hypodermic needle. 
[46]			Did you know that the first Matrix 			was designed to be a perfect human 			world? Where none suffered, where 			everyone would be happy. It was a 			disaster. No one would accept the 			program. Entire crops were lost. 	Agent Brown jams the needle into Morpheus' shoulder, and 	plunges down. 
[47]			Some believed we lacked the 			programming language to describe 			your perfect world. But I believe 			that, as a species, human beings 			define their reality through 			suffering and misery. 	Agent Brown studies the screens as the life signs react 	violently to the injection. 
[48]			The perfect world was a dream that 			your primitive cerebrum kept 			trying to wake up from. Which is 			why the Matrix was re-designed to 			this:  the peak of your 			civilization. 	He turns from the window. 
[49]			I say 'your civilization' because 			as soon as we start thinking for 			you, it really becomes our 			civilization, which is, of course, 			what this is all about. 	He sits down directly in front of Morpheus. 
[50]			Evolution, Morpheus. Evolution. 	He lifts Morpheus' head. 
[51]			Like the dinosaur. Look out that 			window. You had your time. 	Morpheus stares hard at him, trying hard not to show the 	pain racking his mind. 
[52]			The future is our world, Morpheus.

scenes.event: Interrogation of Neo by Agent Smith
scenes.location: An office within the Matrix
scenes.description: Agent Smith interrogates Neo about his double life and his connection with Morpheus, while Neo is trapped and unable to speak.

characters.name: Agent Smith
characters.description: A relentless and powerful agent within the Matrix, with a cold and calculating demeanor.
characters.position: Standing in front of Neo, dominant and in control of the situation.
characters.states: Calm and collected, with an air of superiority and authority.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: A computer programmer by day and a hacker known as Neo by night, he is now a target of the agents.
characters.position: Seated in a chair, trapped and unable to move, his mouth sealed shut.
characters.states: Terrified, confused, and struggling against the control of the agents.

actions.action: Agent Smith questions Neo about his activities and connections, revealing his knowledge of Neo's double life.
actions.dialogue: Agent Smith: 'It seems that you have been living two lives, Mr. Anderson... One of these lives has a future. One of them does not.'

actions.action: Neo tries to communicate but is unable to due to the agents' control over him, his panic growing as he realizes he is trapped.
actions.dialogue: Neo's thoughts: 'Wild with fear, he lunges for the door but the agents restrain him, holding him in the chair.'

scenes.plot: Agent Smith is attempting to extract information from Neo about his activities as a hacker and his connection to Morpheus, while Neo is in a state of helplessness and fear.

scenes.event: The Interrogation of a Key Resistance Member
scenes.time: Evening, within the Matrix, date uncertain
scenes.location: A dimly lit interrogation chamber in a government facility, with a view of the city's skyline
scenes.description: The atmosphere is tense and cold. The room is equipped with advanced monitoring systems and a single chair in the center, where the subject is bound.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: The protagonist, a hacker turned resistance fighter, known for his exceptional abilities within the Matrix. He is currently a prime target for the Agents.
characters.position: Strapped to the chair, surrounded by monitors, his expression is one of defiance and resilience.
characters.states: Calm yet alert, despite the discomfort of his bindings.

characters.name: Agent Smith
characters.description: An Agent of the Matrix, designed to monitor and control the system. He is characterized by his menacing demeanor and ruthless pursuit of the resistance.
characters.position: Moves deliberately around the chamber, positioning himself in front of Neo during the interrogation.
characters.states: Deliberate, menacing, and focused on extracting information from Neo.

actions.action: Agent Smith approaches Neo, his movements deliberate and menacing. He proceeds with the interrogation, using both physical and psychological tactics.
actions.dialogue: Agent Smith taunts Neo with insights into human nature and the futility of resistance.

actions.action: Remains steadfast in the face of Agent Smith's interrogation, showing no signs of breaking or providing information.
actions.dialogue: Neo maintains his composure, offering no response to Agent Smith's taunts, demonstrating his inner strength and commitment to the resistance.

scenes.plot: The scene focuses on the intense interrogation of Neo by Agent Smith. Despite the oppressive environment and the relentless tactics of the Agent, Neo remains steadfast, hinting at a deeper strength that could threaten the Matrix's control.

chunk.text:
[32]			So, we meet at last. 
[33]			Smith. I am Agent Smith. 
[34]			I've been waiting for this noment. 	Faster than a snake spits, Morpheus cracks Smith with a 	jaw-breaking right. 
[35]			You can't win. 	Morpheus smiles. 
[36]			Take him. 	Cops swarm over Morpheus. 
[37]			The others were lost. 
[38]			You've taken care of Reagan? 	Agent Jones nods. 
[39]			Then the others do not matter. 
[40]			There is a problem. Reagan has 			failed to secure the hardware. 	Agent Smith stares out the window. 
[41]			Never send a human to do a 			machine's job. 
[42]			But if Reagan has failed, why 			haven't they pulled the plug? 
[43]			Haven't you learned by now, that 			it is impossible to understand why 			they do the things they do? 	He turns. 
[44]			Continue as planned. Trace his 			signal to locate their position 			and deploy an extermination unit. 	Morpheus is handcuffed to a chair, stripped to the waist. 	He is bleeding from numerous wounds and is pumped full of 	serum, alternately shivering and sweating. He is hooked 	up to various monitors with white disk electrodes. 	Agent Brown begins running a trace program. 
[45]			Have you ever stood and stared at 			it, Morpheus? Marveled at its 			beauty. Its genius. Billions of 			people just living out their 			lives. . . oblivious. 	Agent Brown sucks a serum from a glass vial, filling a 	hypodermic needle. 
[46]			Did you know that the first Matrix 			was designed to be a perfect human 			world? Where none suffered, where 			everyone would be happy. It was a 			disaster. No one would accept the 			program. Entire crops were lost. 	Agent Brown jams the needle into Morpheus' shoulder, and 	plunges down. 
[47]			Some believed we lacked the 			programming language to describe 			your perfect world. But I believe 			that, as a species, human beings 			define their reality through 			suffering and misery. 	Agent Brown studies the screens as the life signs react 	violently to the injection. 
[48]			The perfect world was a dream that 			your primitive cerebrum kept 			trying to wake up from. Which is 			why the Matrix was re-designed to 			this:  the peak of your 			civilization. 	He turns from the window. 
[49]			I say 'your civilization' because 			as soon as we start thinking for 			you, it really becomes our 			civilization, which is, of course, 			what this is all about. 	He sits down directly in front of Morpheus. 
[50]			Evolution, Morpheus. Evolution. 	He lifts Morpheus' head. 
[51]			Like the dinosaur. Look out that 			window. You had your time. 	Morpheus stares hard at him, trying hard not to show the 	pain racking his mind. 
[52]			The future is our world, Morpheus. 			The future is our time. 
[53]			I'd like to share a revelation 			that I've had during my time here. 			It came to me when I tried to 			classify your species. I've 			realized that you are not actually 			mammals. 	The life signs continue their chaotic patterns. 
[54]			Every mammal on this planet 			instinctively develops a natural 			equilibrium with the surrounding 			environment. But you humans do 			not. You move to an area and you 			multiply and multiply until every 			natural resource is consumed and 			the only way you can survive is to 			spread to another area. 	He leans forward. 
[55]			There is another organism on this 			planet that follows the same 			pattern. Do you know what it is? 			A virus. 	He smiles. 
[56]			Human beings are a disease, a 			cancer of this planet. You are a 			plague. And we are. . . the cure. 
[57]			Why isn't the serum working? 
[58]			Perhaps we are asking the wrong 			questions. 
[59]			Or he doesn't know. 
[60]			Of course he knows. He's 			resisting. 
[61]			How? 
[62]			I don't know. If I knew. . . 	Agent Smith hides his knotting fist. He is becoming 	angry. It is something that isn't supposed to happen to 	agents. 
[63]			Leave me with him. 	Agent Brown and Jones look at each other. 
[64]			Now! 
[65]			Can you hear me, Morpheus? I'm 			going to be honest with you. 	He removes his earphone, letting it dangle over his 	shoulder. 
[66]			I hate this place. This zoo. 			This prison. This reality, 			whatever you want to call it, I 			can't stand it any longer. It's 			the smell, if there is such a 			thing. I feel saturated by it. I 			can taste your stink and every 			time I do, I fear that I've 			somehow been infected by it. 	He wipes sweat from Morpheus' forehead, coating the tips 	of his fingers, holding them to Morpheus' nose. 
[67]			Repulsive, isn't it? 	He lifts Morpheus' head, holding it tightly with both 	hands. 
[68]			I must get out of here, I must get 			free. In this mind is tlie key. 			My key. 	Morpheus sneers through his pain. 
[69]			Once Zion is gone, there's no 			need for me to be here. Do you 			understand? I need the codes. I 			have to get inside Zion. You have 			to tell me how. 	He begins squeezing, his fingers gouging into his flesh. 
[70]			Tell me! Tell me! 	The skull is about to shatter when Agents Jones and Brown 	burst into the room. Agent Smith releases Morpheus. 
[71]			What were you doing?

scenes.event: Interrogation of Morpheus by Agent Smith
scenes.location: A room with a view of the city, possibly a government facility
scenes.description: Morpheus is handcuffed to a chair, being interrogated by Agent Smith while other agents look on. The atmosphere is tense, with Morpheus suffering from wounds and the effects of a serum.

characters.name: Morpheus
characters.description: A resistance leader, skilled in martial arts and deep believer in the truth about the Matrix.
characters.position: Handcuffed to a chair in the center of the room, stripped to the waist, bleeding and hooked up to monitors.
characters.states: In pain, alternately shivering and sweating due to the serum.

characters.name: Agent Smith
characters.description: A sentient program within the Matrix, designed to maintain the status quo and eliminate threats to the system.
characters.position: Standing in front of Morpheus, with a cold and calculating demeanor.
characters.states: Increasingly angry and frustrated as the interrogation progresses.

characters.name: Agent Brown
characters.description: Another sentient program, assisting Agent Smith in the interrogation.
characters.position: Nearby, running a trace program and observing the monitors.
characters.states: Calm and focused on the task at hand.

characters.name: Agent Jones
characters.description: A fellow sentient program, present during the interrogation and assisting Agent Brown.
characters.position: Also nearby, ready to intervene if necessary.
characters.states: Alert and watchful.

actions.action: Agent Smith questions Morpheus about the location of Zion and the codes to gain access, becoming violent when not getting the answers he wants.
actions.dialogue: Agent Smith: 'Tell me, Morpheus! I need the codes. I have to get inside Zion. You have to tell me how.'

actions.action: Morpheus resists, sneering through the pain and refusing to give up the information.
actions.dialogue: Morpheus: [No direct quote, but his resistance is evident through his actions and demeanor.]

actions.action: Agent Brown administers a serum to Morpheus in an attempt to break his resistance, and observes the effects on the monitors.
actions.dialogue: Agent Brown: [No dialogue, but his actions are described.]

scenes.plot: Agent Smith interrogates Morpheus to gain access to Zion, while Morpheus resists the interrogation and the effects of the serum. Other agents are present to assist in the process, creating a tense and confrontational scenario.

[48]			The perfect world was a dream that 			your primitive cerebrum kept 			trying to wake up from. Which is 			why the Matrix was re-designed to 			this:  the peak of your 			civilization. 	He turns from the window. 
[49]			I say 'your civilization' because 			as soon as we start thinking for 			you, it really becomes our 			civilization, which is, of course, 			what this is all about. 	He sits down directly in front of Morpheus. 
[50]			Evolution, Morpheus. Evolution. 	He lifts Morpheus' head. 
[51]			Like the dinosaur. Look out that 			window. You had your time. 	Morpheus stares hard at him, trying hard not to show the 	pain racking his mind. 
[52]			The future is our world, Morpheus. 			The future is our time. 
[53]			I'd like to share a revelation 			that I've had during my time here. 			It came to me when I tried to 			classify your species. I've 			realized that you are not actually 			mammals. 	The life signs continue their chaotic patterns. 
[54]			Every mammal on this planet 			instinctively develops a natural 			equilibrium with the surrounding 			environment. But you humans do 			not. You move to an area and you 			multiply and multiply until every 			natural resource is consumed and 			the only way you can survive is to 			spread to another area. 	He leans forward. 
[55]			There is another organism on this 			planet that follows the same 			pattern. Do you know what it is? 			A virus. 	He smiles. 
[56]			Human beings are a disease, a 			cancer of this planet. You are a 			plague. And we are. . . the cure. 
[57]			Why isn't the serum working? 
[58]			Perhaps we are asking the wrong 			questions. 
[59]			Or he doesn't know. 
[60]			Of course he knows. He's 			resisting. 
[61]			How? 
[62]			I don't know. If I knew. . . 	Agent Smith hides his knotting fist. He is becoming 	angry. It is something that isn't supposed to happen to 	agents. 
[63]			Leave me with him. 	Agent Brown and Jones look at each other. 
[64]			Now! 
[65]			Can you hear me, Morpheus? I'm 			going to be honest with you. 	He removes his earphone, letting it dangle over his 	shoulder. 
[66]			I hate this place. This zoo. 			This prison. This reality, 			whatever you want to call it, I 			can't stand it any longer. It's 			the smell, if there is such a 			thing. I feel saturated by it. I 			can taste your stink and every 			time I do, I fear that I've 			somehow been infected by it. 	He wipes sweat from Morpheus' forehead, coating the tips 	of his fingers, holding them to Morpheus' nose. 
[67]			Repulsive, isn't it? 	He lifts Morpheus' head, holding it tightly with both 	hands. 
[68]			I must get out of here, I must get 			free. In this mind is tlie key. 			My key. 	Morpheus sneers through his pain. 
[69]			Once Zion is gone, there's no 			need for me to be here. Do you 			understand? I need the codes. I 			have to get inside Zion. You have 			to tell me how. 	He begins squeezing, his fingers gouging into his flesh. 
[70]			Tell me! Tell me! 	The skull is about to shatter when Agents Jones and Brown 	burst into the room. Agent Smith releases Morpheus. 
[71]			What were you doing?

scenes.event: Neo's encounter with Agents Smith and Brown
scenes.location: An interrogation room within the Matrix
scenes.description: Neo is trapped and under attack by Agents Smith and Brown, who are attempting to extract information from him.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: The protagonist of the story, a human who has been awakened to the truth about the Matrix. He is currently in a state of panic and attempting to resist the agents.
characters.position: Strapped to a chair in the center of the room, unable to move
characters.states: Panicked, attempting to break free

characters.name: Agent Smith
characters.description: A sentient program within the Matrix, an agent tasked with maintaining the order of the system. He is relentless and appears to take pleasure in causing fear and pain.
characters.position: Standing in front of Neo, ready to apply further pressure
characters.states: Calm, yet menacing

characters.name: Agent Brown
characters.description: Another agent within the Matrix, working alongside Agent Smith. He is assisting in the interrogation of Neo.
characters.position: Standing beside Agent Smith, ready to support
characters.states: Focused, assisting Agent Smith

actions.action: Agent Smith taunts Neo, increasing his panic by describing the futility of his situation and the inevitability of his fate.
actions.dialogue: You can't win, Mr. Anderson.

actions.action: Neo struggles against his restraints, trying to break free from the chair.
actions.dialogue: Nooo!

actions.action: Agent Brown supports Agent Smith, ready to take action if Neo attempts to escape.
actions.dialogue: You're empty.

scenes.plot: This scene is a pivotal moment where Neo's fate hangs in the balance as he is interrogated by the relentless Agents Smith and Brown.

The standing agents snicker, watching Neo's confusion 	grow into panic. 	Neo feels his lips grow soft and sticky as they slowly 	seal shut, melding into each other until all trace of his 	mouth is gone. 	Wild with fear, he lunges for the door but the agents 	restrain him holding him in the chair. 
[18]			You are going to help us, Mr. 			Anderson, whether you want to or 			not. 	Smith nods and the other two rip open his shirt. 	From a case taken out of his suit coat, Smith removes a 	long, fiber-optic wire tap. 	Neo struggles helplessly as Smith dangles the wire over 	his exposed abdomen. Horrified, he watches as the 	electronic device animates, become an organic creature 	that resembles a hybrid of an insect and a fluke worm. 	Thin, whisker-like tendrils reach out and probe into 	Neo's navel. He bucks wildly as Smith drops the creature 	which looks for a moment like an uncut umbilical cord --  	Before it begins to burrow its, tail thrashing as it 	worms its way inside. 
[19]			Do we have a deal, Mr. Reagan? 	Cypher chews the steak loudly, smacking it between his 	teeth. 
[20]			Then we have a deal? 
[21]			Whatever you want, Mr. Reagan. 	Cypher takes a deep drink of wine. 
[22]			Access codes to Zion. 
[23]			Morpheus. 
[24]			Eighth floor. They're on the 			eighth floor.

[54]			Now!

I feel saturated by it. I 			can taste your stink and every 			time I do, I fear that I've 			somehow been infected by it. 	He wipes sweat from Morpheus' forehead, coating the tips 	of his fingers, holding them to Morpheus' nose. 
[57]			Repulsive, isn't it? 	He lifts Morpheus' head, holding it tightly with both 	hands. 
[58]			I must get out of here, I must get 			free. In this mind is tlie key. 			My key. 	Morpheus sneers through his pain. 
[59]			Once Zion is gone, there's no 			need for me to be here. Do you 			understand? I need the codes. I 			have to get inside Zion. You have 			to tell me how. 	He begins squeezing, his fingers gouging into his flesh. 
[60]			Tell me! Tell me! 	The skull is about to shatter when Agents Jones and Brown 	burst into the room. Agent Smith releases Morpheus. 
[61]			Know what? 	Agent Smith listens to his earphone, not believing what 	he is hearing. 
[62]			Find them and destroy them! 	Agent Jones nods and touches his ear piece. 
[63]			No. 	The GUN jumps and BULLETS EXPLODE through the WINDOW in a 	cacophony of CRASHING GLASS --  	As the Agents go for their weapons. 	But Neo is too close, the . 50 CALIBER too fast and 	BULLETS are everywhere, perforating the room. 	Agent Smith is hit first, his body jack-knifing back, 	blood arcing out with a sudden flash of light --  	Then Agent Brown, his GUN still FIRING as his body falls. 	And finally Agent Jones. 	Neo stares at Morpheus, trying to will him into action. 
[64]			Nooo! 	He FIRES, sweeping across the sheetrocked wall in a 	perfect line. 	For an instant, we see the BULLETS SHRED, PUNCTURING the 	WALL, searing through the wet air with jet trails of 	chalk. 	And as Morpheus starts to dive for the window, a bullet 	buries itself in his leg --  	Knocking him off balance. 
[65]			They're not out yet. 
[66]			You're empty. 	Neo pulls the TRIGGER. CLICK. 
[67]			You can't win. 
[68]			Do you hear that, Mr. Anderson? 	Agent Smith grabs Neo in a choke-hold, forcing him to 	look down the tracks, the train's headlight burning a 	hole in the darkness. 
[69]			That is the sound of 			inevitability. 	Neo sees it coming and he starts to fight. 
[70]			It is the sound of your death. 	There is another METAL SCREECH, MUCH LOUDER, closer, as 	Agent Smith tightens his hold. Neo is unable to breathe. 
[71]			Goodbye, Mr. Anderson. 	The TRAIN ROARS at them, swallowing Agent Smith's words. 	The veins bulge in Neo's head, as he grits through the 	pain. 	He is not ready to die. 
[72]			Check him. 
[73]			I told you, you couldn't win.

scenes.location: A building rooftop in the city
scenes.description: A intense gunfight breaks out between the Agents and Neo, with Agent Smith recovering from an injury and observing the chaos from the edge of the building.

characters.name: Agent Smith
characters.description: A relentless and powerful Agent of the Matrix, with cold and determined eyes, wearing a black suit.
characters.position: Standing at the edge of the building, looking out over the city.
characters.states: Recovered from an earlier injury, now observing the fight with a sense of control and anticipation.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: The protagonist, known as the One, with a strong will and exceptional combat abilities, dressed in black leather.
characters.position: In the midst of the gunfight, actively engaging the Agents with firearms.
characters.states: Determined and focused, showing no sign of fear or hesitation in the face of the overwhelming force.

characters.name: Agent Jones
characters.description: An Agent of the Matrix, similar in attire and abilities to Agent Smith, with a mechanical and relentless approach.
characters.position: Engaged in the gunfight, but suddenly realizes that Trinity is missing.
characters.states: Initially confident, but then surprised and possibly concerned when he notices the disappearance of Trinity.

actions.action: Replaces his ear piece and recovers from an injury, then moves to the edge of the building to oversee the situation.
actions.dialogue: None

actions.action: Engages in a gunfight with the Agents, showing great skill and determination.
actions.dialogue: None

actions.action: Participates in the gunfight, but is interrupted when he realizes that Trinity is gone, which causes a moment of distraction.
actions.dialogue: None

scenes.plot: The scene involves a high-octane gunfight between Neo and multiple Agents, with Agent Smith recovering and overseeing the chaos from a distance, and Agent Jones momentarily thrown off guard by the disappearance of Trinity.

[1]			Lieutenant? 
[2]			Lieutenant, you were given 			specific orders --  
[3]			The orders were for your protection. 	The Lieutenant laughs. 
[4]			No, Lieutenant, your men are dead. 
[5]			Did you get anything from the 			room? 
[6]			We'll need a search running. 
[7]			As you can see, we've had our eye 			on you for some time now, Mr. 			Anderson. 	He opens the file. Paper rattle marks the silence as he 	flips several pages. Neo cannot tell if he is looking at 	the file or at him. 
[8]			It seems that you have been living 			two lives. In one life, you are 			Thomas A. Anderson, program writer 			for a respectable software 			company. You have a social 			security number, you pay your 			taxes and you help your land lady 			carry out her garbage. 	The pages continue to turn. 
[9]			The other life is lived in 			computers where you go by the 			hacker alias Neo, and are guilty 			of virtually every computer crime 			we have a law for, including the 			unauthorized use of the D. M. V. 			system for the removal of 			automobile boots. 	Neo feels himself sinking into a pit of shit. 
[10]			One of these,lives has a future. 			One of them does not. 	He closes the file. 
[11]			I'm going to be as forthcoming as 			I can be, Mr. Anderson. You are 			here because we need your help. 	He removes his sunglasses; his eyes are an unnatural ice- 	blue.

Whatever you think you know about 			this man is irrelevant to the fact 			that he is wanted for acts of 			terrorism in more countries than 			any other man in the world. He is 			considered by many authorities to 			be the most dangerous man alive. 	He leans closer.

That is why I believe you 			are ready to put your past 			mistakes behind you and get on 			with your life. 	Neo tries to match his stare.

scenes.location: An elevated train track above a busy city street
scenes.description: Neo is in a dangerous situation after being chased by police officers, and Apoc comes to his rescue.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: A younger man who is more comfortable living inside a computer than outside one.
characters.position: Hanging from the raised train tracks
characters.states: Panicked and in immediate danger

characters.name: Apoc
characters.description: A character who is helping Neo escape from the police.
characters.position: Nearby, ready to assist Neo
characters.states: Calm and focused on the rescue

characters.name: Police Officers
characters.description: Officers who are pursuing Neo.
characters.position: Below, on the city street
characters.states: Aggressive and determined

actions.action: Grabs Neo and yanks him to the nearest exit.
actions.dialogue: Come with me.

actions.action: Is pulled to safety by Apoc.
actions.dialogue: Hurtling towards a busy city street when, out of nowhere, a truck races under him and --

actions.action: Are thrown back as the train emergency brakes.
actions.dialogue: The cops are thrown back.

scenes.plot: This scene is a critical moment in the film where Neo is being pursued by police officers. Apoc steps in to rescue Neo, ultimately leading to Neo's survival and continuation of his journey within the Matrix.

[37]			No way, no way, this is crazy. 
[38]			This is insane! Why is this 			happening to me? What did I do? 			I'm nobody. I didn't do anything. 			Fuck! Fuck! Fuck! 	He climbs up onto the window ledge. Hanging onto the 	frame, he steps onto the small ledge. 	The scaffold seems even farther away. 
[39]			I'm going to die. 	The WIND suddenly BLASTS up the face of the building, 	knocking Neo off balance. Recoiling, he clings harder to 	the frame, and the phone falls out of his hand. 	He watches as it is swallowed by the distance beneath him. 
[40]			This is insane. I can't do this! 			Forget it! 	He climbs back into the office just as a cop opens the 	door. 
[41]			I didn't do anything! 
[42]			Yeah. Wow. That sounds like a 			real good deal. But I think I 			have a better one. How about I 			give you the finger --  	He does. 
[43]			And you can cram that file up your 			Secret Service sphincter. 	Agent Smith puts his glasses back on. 
[44]			You ain't seen nothing yet. 
[45]			You can't scare me with this 			gestapo crap. I know my rights. 			I want my phone call. 	Agent Smith smiles. 
[46] 	Screaming, Neo bolts upright in bed. 	He realizes that he is home. Was it a dream? His mouth 	is normal. His stomach looks fine. He starts to take a 	deep, everything-is-okay breath, when --  	The PHONE RINGS. 	It almost stops his heart. It CONTINUES RINGING, 	building pressure in the room, forcing him up out of bed, 	sucking him in with an almost gravitational force. 	He answers it, saying nothing. 
[47]			The agents --  
[48]			. . . Yes. 
[49]			What are you doing? 
[50]			What are you doing? 
[51]			Jesus! God! 
[52]			Do what? 	The instant he hears the word, he knows. 
[53]			Oh, shit --  	The cry is frozen in his mouth as the paddles hit his 	chest. Gizmo wrestles with the bug. 
[54]			It's an honor. 
[55]			You could say that. 
[56]			You're Morpheus, you're a legend. 			Most hackers would die to meet 			you. 
[57]			No. 
[58]			Because I don't like the idea that 			I'm not in control of my life. 
[59]			What gift? 
[60]			It's not magic. 
[61]			Free from what? 
[62]			What truth? 
[63]			How? 
[64]			Apoc? You wrote the Four Horsemen 			Virus. 
[65]			A little. 
[66]			Essentially, it's a hardware 			system that uses an apparatus; 			headgear, gloves and whatever to 			make you feel that you are in a 			computer program. 
[67]			You might not, no. 
[68]			You did all this? 	She nods, placing a set of headphones over his ears. 	They are wired to an old hotel phone. 
[69]			Shit. . . 	Cypher works with Apoc checking reams of phosphorescent 	data. Trinity monitors Neo's electric vital signs. 	Neo reaches out to touch the mirror and his fingers 	disappear beneath the rippling surface. 	Quickly, he tries to pull his fingers out but the mirror 	stretches in long rubbery strands like mirrored-taffy 	stuck to his fingertips. 
[70]			What is this? Mescaline? 
[71]			Uh-oh. . . 
[72]			It's cold. 	The mirror creeps up his neck as Neo begins to panic, 	tipping his head as though he were sinking into the 	mirror, trying to keep his mouth up. 
[73]			It's all over me --  	Morpheus is right next to him, with the phone. 
[74] 	Neo's eyes flutter open. We see Trinity's face above us, 	angelic in the fluorescent glow of a light stick. 
[75] 
[76]			. . . am I dead? 
[77] 	He opens his eyes again, something tingling through him. 	He focuses and sees his body pierced with dozens of 	acupuncture-like needles wired to a strange device.

scenes.event: Neo's interrogation and torture by Agent Smith
scenes.location: An interrogation room within the Matrix
scenes.description: Neo is being interrogated and tortured by Agent Smith while other agents observe. The room is dimly lit with a single overhead light, and the atmosphere is tense and hostile.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: The protagonist of the story, a man who is learning about the true nature of the Matrix. He is depicted as having a sense of confusion and panic as the scene unfolds.
characters.position: Strapped to a chair in the center of the room, his shirt is ripped open and he is exposed to thewire tap insertion.
characters.states: Fear, confusion, and helplessness as his mouthand the wire tap is inserted into his abdomen.

characters.name: Agent Smith
characters.description: A main antagonist, an agent of the Matrix with a cold and calculating demeanor. He is shown to be in control of the situation and takes pleasure in Neo's suffering.
characters.position: Standing in front of Neo, brandishing the wire tap. Later, he is seen watching Morpheus being tortured.
characters.states: Calm, collected, and sadistic as he inflicts pain on Neo.

characters.name: Other Agents
characters.description: Additional agents who are present during the interrogation, they observe and snicker at Neo's plight.
characters.position: Standing around the room, watching the events unfold.
characters.states: Amused and mocking as they witness Neo's panic.

actions.action: Agent Smith removes a long, fiber-optic wire tap from his case and dangles it over Neo's exposed abdomen, before inserting it.
actions.dialogue: None

actions.action: Neo struggles against his restraints and tries to lunge for the door, but is held back by the agents.
actions.dialogue: None

actions.action: The other agents snicker and watch as Neo's confusion and panic grow.
actions.dialogue: None

scenes.plot: This scene is a pivotal moment in the movie where Neo's helplessness against the agents is highlighted, setting the stage for his later transformation and rebellion against the Matrix.

chunk.text:
The question unnerves Neo and strangely, he begins to 	feel the muscles in his jaw tighten. 	The standing agents snicker, watching Neo's confusion 	grow into panic. 	Neo feels his lips grow soft and sticky as they slowly 	seal shut, melding into each other until all trace of his 	mouth is gone. 	Wild with fear, he lunges for the door but the agents 	restrain him holding him in the chair. 
[18]			You are going to help us, Mr. 			Anderson, whether you want to or 			not. 	Smith nods and the other two rip open his shirt. 	From a case taken out of his suit coat, Smith removes a 	long, fiber-optic wire tap. 	Neo struggles helplessly as Smith dangles the wire over 	his exposed abdomen. Horrified, he watches as the 	electronic device animates, become an organic creature 	that resembles a hybrid of an insect and a fluke worm. 	Thin, whisker-like tendrils reach out and probe into 	Neo's navel. He bucks wildly as Smith drops the creature 	which looks for a moment like an uncut umbilical cord --  	Before it begins to burrow its, tail thrashing as it 	worms its way inside. 
[19]			Do we have a deal, Mr. Reagan? 	Cypher chews the steak loudly, smacking it between his 	teeth. 
[20]			Then we have a deal? 
[21]			Whatever you want, Mr. Reagan. 	Cypher takes a deep drink of wine. 
[22]			Access codes to Zion. 
[23]			Morpheus. 
[24]			Eighth floor. They're on the 			eighth floor. 
[25]			Are orders that hard to follow? 			I'll say it again. Morpheus must 			be taken alive. Understand? 
[26]			How like a rodent. 
[27]			We have them now. 
[28]			So, we meet at last. 
[29]			Smith. I am Agent Smith. 
[30]			I've been waiting for this noment. 	Faster than a snake spits, Morpheus cracks Smith with a 	jaw-breaking right. 
[31]			You can't win. 	Morpheus smiles. 
[32]			Take him. 	Cops swarm over Morpheus. 
[33]			You've taken care of Reagan? 	Agent Jones nods. 
[34]			Then the others do not matter. 
[35]			Never send a human to do a 			machine's job. 
[36]			Haven't you learned by now, that 			it is impossible to understand why 			they do the things they do? 	He turns. 
[37]			Continue as planned. Trace his 			signal to locate their position 			and deploy an extermination unit. 	Morpheus is handcuffed to a chair, stripped to the waist. 	He is bleeding from numerous wounds and is pumped full of 	serum, alternately shivering and sweating. He is hooked 	up to various monitors with white disk electrodes. 	Agent Brown begins running a trace program. 
[38]			Have you ever stood and stared at 			it, Morpheus? Marveled at its 			beauty. Its genius. Billions of 			people just living out their 			lives. . . oblivious. 	Agent Brown sucks a serum from a glass vial, filling a 	hypodermic needle. 
[39]			Did you know that the first Matrix 			was designed to be a perfect human 			world? Where none suffered, where 			everyone would be happy. It was a 			disaster. No one would accept the 			program. Entire crops were lost. 	Agent Brown jams the needle into Morpheus' shoulder, and 	plunges down. 
[40]			Some believed we lacked the 			programming language to describe 			your perfect world. But I believe 			that, as a species, human beings 			define their reality through 			suffering and misery. 	Agent Brown studies the screens as the life signs react 	violently to the injection. 
[41]			The perfect world was a dream that 			your primitive cerebrum kept 			trying to wake up from. Which is 			why the Matrix was re-designed to 			this:  the peak of your 			civilization. 	He turns from the window. 
[42]			I say 'your civilization' because 			as soon as we start thinking for 			you, it really becomes our 			civilization, which is, of course, 			what this is all about. 	He sits down directly in front of Morpheus. 
[43]			Evolution, Morpheus. Evolution. 	He lifts Morpheus' head. 
[44]			Like the dinosaur. Look out that 			window. You had your time. 	Morpheus stares hard at him, trying hard not to show the 	pain racking his mind. 
[45]			The future is our world, Morpheus. 			The future is our time. 
[46]			I'd like to share a revelation 			that I've had during my time here. 			It came to me when I tried to 			classify your species. I've 			realized that you are not actually 			mammals. 	The life signs continue their chaotic patterns. 
[47]			Every mammal on this planet 			instinctively develops a natural 			equilibrium with the surrounding 			environment. But you humans do 			not. You move to an area and you 			multiply and multiply until every 			natural resource is consumed and 			the only way you can survive is to 			spread to another area. 	He leans forward. 
[48]			There is another organism on this 			planet that follows the same 			pattern. Do you know what it is? 			A virus. 	He smiles. 
[49]			Human beings are a disease, a 			cancer of this planet. You are a 			plague. And we are. . . the cure. 
[50]			Why isn't the serum working? 
[51]			Of course he knows. He's 			resisting. 
[52]			I don't know. If I knew. . . 	Agent Smith hides his knotting fist. He is becoming 	angry. It is something that isn't supposed to happen to 	agents. 
[53]			Leave me with him. 	Agent Brown and Jones look at each other. 
[54]			Now! 
[55]			Can you hear me, Morpheus? I'm 			going to be honest with you. 	He removes his earphone, letting it dangle over his 	shoulder.

scenes.location: A room within the Matrix
scenes.description: The atmosphere is tense with the smell of ozone and the hum of machinery. The room is dimly lit, with wires hanging from the ceiling and monitors flickering in the background.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: The One, a hacker turned savior, equipped with skills to navigate the Matrix.
characters.position: Standing at the entrance of the room, ready to engage.
characters.states: Determined, alert, and prepared for action.

characters.name: Morpheus
characters.description: A wise and respected leader of the resistance, currently under duress.
characters.position: Strapped to an interrogation chair, facing Agent Smith with defiance.
characters.states: Pained, yet calm and expecting Neo's intervention.

characters.name: Agent Smith
characters.description: A relentless Agent, focused on extracting information from Morpheus.
characters.position: Leaning over Morpheus, exuding a menacing presence.
characters.states: Angry, focused, and confident in his interrogation tactics.

actions.action: Agent Smith is employing intense interrogation methods on Morpheus, aiming to break his will.
actions.dialogue: Agent Smith: 'You can't hide from the truth!'

actions.action: Neo enters the room with a burst of gunfire, targeting Agent Smith to protect Morpheus.
actions.dialogue: Neo: 'This is where it ends!'

actions.action: Morpheus attempts to maneuver out of the line of fire, showing his resilience.
actions.dialogue: Morpheus: 'Now, Neo!'

scenes.plot: In a tense and pivotal moment, Neo interrupts Agent Smith's interrogation of Morpheus, leading to a daring rescue attempt amidst the chaos of the Matrix.

chunk.text:
[56]			I hate this place. This zoo. 			This prison. This reality, 			whatever you want to call it, I 			can't stand it any longer. It's 			the smell, if there is such a 			thing. I feel saturated by it. I 			can taste your stink and every 			time I do, I fear that I've 			somehow been infected by it. 	He wipes sweat from Morpheus' forehead, coating the tips 	of his fingers, holding them to Morpheus' nose. 
[57]			Repulsive, isn't it? 	He lifts Morpheus' head, holding it tightly with both 	hands. 
[58]			I must get out of here, I must get 			free. In this mind is tlie key. 			My key. 	Morpheus sneers through his pain. 
[59]			Once Zion is gone, there's no 			need for me to be here. Do you 			understand? I need the codes. I 			have to get inside Zion. You have 			to tell me how. 	He begins squeezing, his fingers gouging into his flesh. 
[60]			Tell me! Tell me! 	The skull is about to shatter when Agents Jones and Brown 	burst into the room. Agent Smith releases Morpheus. 
[61]			Know what? 	Agent Smith listens to his earphone, not believing what 	he is hearing. 
[62]			Find them and destroy them! 	Agent Jones nods and touches his ear piece. 
[63]			No. 	The GUN jumps and BULLETS EXPLODE through the WINDOW in a 	cacophony of CRASHING GLASS --  	As the Agents go for their weapons. 	But Neo is too close, the . 50 CALIBER too fast and 	BULLETS are everywhere, perforating the room. 	Agent Smith is hit first, his body jack-knifing back, 	blood arcing out with a sudden flash of light --  	Then Agent Brown, his GUN still FIRING as his body falls. 	And finally Agent Jones. 	Neo stares at Morpheus, trying to will him into action. 
[64]			Nooo! 	He FIRES, sweeping across the sheetrocked wall in a 	perfect line. 	For an instant, we see the BULLETS SHRED, PUNCTURING the 	WALL, searing through the wet air with jet trails of 	chalk. 	And as Morpheus starts to dive for the window, a bullet 	buries itself in his leg --  	Knocking him off balance. 
[65]			They're not out yet. 
[66]			You're empty. 	Neo pulls the TRIGGER. CLICK. 
[67]			You can't win. 
[68]			Do you hear that, Mr. Anderson? 	Agent Smith grabs Neo in a choke-hold, forcing him to 	look down the tracks, the train's headlight burning a 	hole in the darkness. 
[69]			That is the sound of 			inevitability. 	Neo sees it coming and he starts to fight. 
[70]			It is the sound of your death. 	There is another METAL SCREECH, MUCH LOUDER, closer, as 	Agent Smith tightens his hold. Neo is unable to breathe. 
[71]			Goodbye, Mr. Anderson. 	The TRAIN ROARS at them, swallowing Agent Smith's words. 	The veins bulge in Neo's head, as he grits through the 	pain. 	He is not ready to die. 
[72]			Check him. 
[73]			I told you, you couldn't win. 
[74]			Nooooo! 	Agent Smith pounds on the elevator door. ",
        "Switch": "
[1]			What if he does? 
[2]			God, I love that sound. 
[3]			Oh God. 	Wearing Tank's operator headgear, Cypher moves among the 	silent bodies. ",
        "Apoc": "
[1]			Come with me. 	Neo stands just as the door at the opposite end opens and 	two police officers rush in, drawing their guns. 	Apoc grabs Neo, muscling him to the nearest exit. There 	is no upcoming station. 	Apoc yanks the emergency brake and the train buckles 	against its own speed. The cops are thrown back. Neo 	slams against the metal rail. 	The doors open onto nothing and just when Neo regains his 	balance, Apoc shoves him backwards --  	He flies out from the train, arms windrilling as he falls 	from, the raised tracks --  	Hurtling towards a busy city street when, out of nowhere, 	a truck races under him and --  	He crashes into a large dumpster-bed filled with empty 	boxes. 
[2]			Almost. 	He and Trinity are working quickly, hardwiring a complex 	system of monitors, modules and drives. 
[3]			That's right. 
[4]			Still nothing. 	Morpheus takes out a cellular phone and dials a number. 
[5]			Targeting. . . almost there. 	An ALARM, on Trinity's monitor ERUPTS. 
[6]			Lock! I got him! 
[7]			Morpheus is right. He's got to be 			the one. 
[8]			No way. Not possible. 
[9]			He won't. 
[10]			What? ! ",
        "Neo": "
[1] 	It is a studio apartirent that seems overgrown with 	technology. 	Weed-like cables coil everywhere, duct-taped into 	thickets that wind up and around the legs of several 	desks. 	Tabletops are filled with cannibalized equipment that lay 	open like an autopsied corpse. 	We turn towards the center of this rat-nest of 	technology, following the slurping and crunching of 	cereal. We pass an open box of Capln Crunch as we find --  	NEO, a younger man who knows more about living inside a 	computer than living outside one. 
[2]			Fuckin' idiots don't know shit. 	He finishes his cereal and is about to disconnect when an 	anonynous message slices onto the screen. 
[3]			What the hell. . . 
[4]			What do you want, Anthony? 
[5]			You got the money this time? 	He holds up two hundred dollars and Neo opens the door. 	Anthony's girlfriend, DUJOUR, stops in front of Neo. 
[6] 	They watch from the window as the cops, silently, 	robotically, climb into their van. 
[7]			I don't know. I have to work 			tomorrow. 
[8]			Yeah, yeah. Sure, I'll go. 
[9]			How did you know that --  
[10]			Who are you? 
[11]			Trinity? The Trinity? The 			Trinity that cracked the I. R. S. 			Kansas City D-Base?

scenes.event: Conflict between Agent Smith and Neo
scenes.location: A room within the Matrix
scenes.description: Agent Smith is interrogating Morpheus while being interrupted by Neo's attack. The room is tense with the smell of sweat and the sound of gunfire.

characters.name: Agent Smith
characters.description: A malicious Agent of the Matrix, determined to extract information from Morpheus.
characters.position: Standing over Morpheus, with a dominating posture.
characters.states: Angry and determined, with a hint of pleasure in causing pain.

characters.name: Morpheus
characters.description: A leader of the resistance, enduring interrogation by Agent Smith.
characters.position: Lying on the ground, bound and in pain.
characters.states: Resilient but in agony, with a look of defiance even in the face of torture.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: The chosen one, attempting to rescue Morpheus from Agent Smith.
characters.position: Crouching outside the window, ready to strike.
characters.states: Focused and ready for action, with a sense of urgency.

actions.action: Agent Smith is interrogating Morpheus, applying physical pressure to coerce information.
actions.dialogue: Agent Smith: 'Tell me! Tell me!'

actions.action: Neo bursts into the room and opens fire on Agent Smith, attempting to save Morpheus.
actions.dialogue: Neo: No dialogue, but the sound of gunfire is deafening.

scenes.plot: Agent Smith is in the process of interrogating Morpheus when Neo dramatically interrupts the scene with a gunfight, highlighting the intense conflict between the protagonists and the Agents of the Matrix.

scenes.location: An office building, eastern corner
scenes.description: A tense atmosphere surrounds the scene, with dim lighting and a growing sense of urgency.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: A computer programmer by day, hacker by night, and the chosen one to free humanity from the Matrix. He is determined and resourceful.
characters.position: Perched on a ledge, overlooking the city
characters.states: Anxious, yet resolute in his escape

characters.name: Agent Smith
characters.description: A relentless AI program within the Matrix, designed to maintain control over humans. He is focused on capturing Neo.
characters.position: Inside the office, closing in on Neo
characters.states: Calm and intent on capturing Neo

actions.action: Neo edges out onto the ledge, his heart pounding, as he attempts to evade Agent Smith.
actions.dialogue: This is crazy. There's got to be another way!

actions.action: Agent Smith advances towards Neo, his demeanor cold and calculating, ready to enforce the system's will.
actions.dialogue: You can't hide from the system, Neo. It's time to face your destiny.

scenes.plot: The scene intensifies the conflict between Neo and Agent Smith, highlighting Neo's determination to escape and Smith's unwavering pursuit.

chunk.text:
[12]			Gee-zus. 
[13]			I just thought. . . you were a guy. 
[14]			Do you want to go sorewhere and 			talk?

[17]			What? Why? 
[18]			I don't understand --  
[19]			The Matrix. What is the Matrix? 
[20]			Wait. Who was it? Who was the 			man? 	She leans close, her lips alrost touching his ear as she 	whispers. 
[21] 	The sound is an ALARM CLOCK, slowly dragging Neo to 	consciousness. He strains to read the clock face: 
[22]			Shitshitshit. 
[23]			Yes, Mr. Rhineheart. Perfectly 			clear. 
[24] 	The entire floor looks like a human honeycomb, with a 	labyrinth of cubicles structured around a core of 	elevators. 	Neo slumps down into his chair. A TALL EMPLOYEE stands 	up in the adjacent cubicle, leaning over the partition. 
[25]			If I was late again, I'm going to 			be fired. 	He smirks. 
[26]			Yeah. That's me. 	Neo signs the electronic pad and the Fedex guy hands him 	the softpak. 
[27]			Hello? 
[28]			. . . no. 
[29]			Who's coming for me? 
[30]			Right now? 
[31]			Holy fuckin' shit! 
[32]			What the fuck do they want with 			me? ! 
[33]			How? ! 
[34]			But what if. . . ? 
[35]			How do you know all this? 	Morpheus laughs quietly. 
[36]			No! It's too far away. 
[37]			No way, no way, this is crazy. 
[38]			This is insane! Why is this 			happening to me? What did I do? 			I'm nobody. I didn't do anything. 			Fuck! Fuck! Fuck! 	He climbs up onto the window ledge. Hanging onto the 	frame, he steps onto the small ledge. 	The scaffold seems even farther away. 
[39]			I'm going to die. 	The WIND suddenly BLASTS up the face of the building, 	knocking Neo off balance. Recoiling, he clings harder to 	the frame, and the phone falls out of his hand. 	He watches as it is swallowed by the distance beneath him. 
[40]			This is insane. I can't do this! 			Forget it! 	He climbs back into the office just as a cop opens the 	door. 
[41]			I didn't do anything! 
[42]			Yeah. Wow. That sounds like a 			real good deal. But I think I 			have a better one. How about I 			give you the finger --  	He does.

[44]			You ain't seen nothing yet.

[46] 	Screaming, Neo bolts upright in bed. 	He realizes that he is home. Was it a dream? His mouth 	is normal. His stomach looks fine. He starts to take a 	deep, everything-is-okay breath, when --  	The PHONE RINGS. 	It almost stops his heart. It CONTINUES RINGING, 	building pressure in the room, forcing him up out of bed, 	sucking him in with an almost gravitational force. 	He answers it, saying nothing. 
[47]			The agents --  
[48]			. . . Yes. 
[49]			What are you doing? 
[50]			What are you doing? 
[51]			Jesus! God! 
[52]			Do what? 	The instant he hears the word, he knows. 
[53]			Oh, shit --  	The cry is frozen in his mouth as the paddles hit his 	chest. Gizmo wrestles with the bug. 
[54]			It's an honor. 
[55]			You could say that. 
[56]			You're Morpheus, you're a legend. 			Most hackers would die to meet 			you. 
[57]			No. 
[58]			Because I don't like the idea that 			I'm not in control of my life. 
[59]			What gift? 
[60]			It's not magic. 
[61]			Free from what? 
[62]			What truth? 
[63]			How? 
[64]			Apoc? You wrote the Four Horsemen 			Virus. 
[65]			A little. 
[66]			Essentially, it's a hardware 			system that uses an apparatus; 			headgear, gloves and whatever to 			make you feel that you are in a 			computer program. 
[67]			You might not, no. 
[68]			You did all this? 	She nods, placing a set of headphones over his ears. 	They are wired to an old hotel phone. 
[69]			Shit. . . 	Cypher works with Apoc checking reams of phosphorescent 	data. Trinity monitors Neo's electric vital signs. 	Neo reaches out to touch the mirror and his fingers 	disappear beneath the rippling surface. 	Quickly, he tries to pull his fingers out but the mirror 	stretches in long rubbery strands like mirrored-taffy 	stuck to his fingertips. 
[70]			What is this? Mescaline? 
[71]			Uh-oh. . . 
[72]			It's cold. 	The mirror creeps up his neck as Neo begins to panic, 	tipping his head as though he were sinking into the 	mirror, trying to keep his mouth up. 
[73]			It's all over me --  	Morpheus is right next to him, with the phone. 
[74] 	Neo's eyes flutter open. We see Trinity's face above us, 	angelic in the fluorescent glow of a light stick. 
[75] 
[76]			. . . am I dead? 
[77] 	He opens his eyes again, something tingling through him.

characters.position: Sitting at his desk, later stepping onto the window ledge in panic

characters.name: Tall Employee

characters.states: Curious and possibly concerned

actions.action: Watches Neo's interaction with the Fedex guy and possibly exchanges a glance or a nod.
actions.dialogue: None mentioned in the extract

actions.dialogue: None mentioned in the extract

scenes.location: Top floor of a Chicago skyscraper
scenes.description: A luxurious restaurant where Cypher is having a steak dinner with Agent Smith. The view is breathtaking and the menu has no prices.

characters.name: Cypher
characters.description: A former hacker who has betrayed the resistance for a life of luxury in the Matrix.
characters.position: Sitting across from Agent Smith at the restaurant table, enjoying a steak.
characters.states: Cypher is smug and satisfied, relishing the taste of the steak and the prospect of his new life.

characters.name: Agent Smith
characters.description: An agent of the Matrix, relentless in his pursuit of the resistance. He is watching Cypher closely.
characters.position: Sitting at the restaurant table with Cypher, observing his every move.
characters.states: Agent Smith is calm and collected, showing a hint of a smile as he watches Cypher.

actions.action: Cypher takes a bite of the steak and expresses his satisfaction with the taste and his decision to betray the resistance.
actions.dialogue: Mmm, so, so fucking good. You know, I know that this steak doesn't exist. I know when I put it in my mouth, the Matrix is telling my brain that it is juicy and delicious.

actions.action: Agent Smith watches Cypher, showing a hint of a smile, and then engages in conversation with him.
actions.dialogue: Welcome to the real world, right? He laughs.

scenes.plot: Cypher is enjoying the pleasures of the Matrix while Agent Smith monitors him, both aware of the impending consequences of their actions.

chunk.text:
Neo swallows another throat- 	scorching mouthful. 
[26]			Welcome to the real world! 
[27]			That's what he said to me nine 			years ago. 	The meat is so perfect, charred on the outside, oozing 	red juice from the inside, that it could be a dream. 
[28]			The real world. Ha, what a joke. 	We recognize the grating voice, the insidious laugh. 
[29]			You know what real is? I'll tell 			you what real is. 	A fork stabs the cube of meat and we FOLLOW it UP TO the 	face of Cypher. 
[30]			Real is just another four-letter 			word. 	He laughs, shoving the steak into his mouth. 	The restaurant is located on the top floor of a Chicago 	skyscraper where the view is breathtaking and the menu 	has no prices. 	Sitting across from Cypher is Agent Smith. 
[31]			Mmm, so, so fucking good. 	Smith watches him shovel another hunk of meat into his 	mouth. 
[32]			You know, I know that this steak 			doesn't exist. I know when I put 			it in my mouth, the Matrix is 			telling my brain that it is juicy 			and delicious. After nine years, 			do you know what I've realized? 	Pausing, he examines the meat skewered on his fork. He 	pops it in, eyes rolling up, savoring the tender beef 	melting in his mouth. 
[33]			Ignorance is bliss. 
[34]			I don't want to remember nothing. 			Nothing! You understand? And I 			want to be rich. Someone 			important. Like an actor. You 			can do that, right? 
[35]			All right. You get my body back 			in a power plant, reinsert me into 			the Matrix and I'll get you what 			you want. 
[36]			I told you, I don't know them. 			But I can give you the man who 			does. 
[37]			That's what they changed. We're 			trapped. There's no way out. 	The sound of heavy BOOT-STEPS close around them with the 	mechanical sureness of a vice. 
[38]			I need an exit! Fast! 
[39]			There was an accident. A fucking 			car accident. All of a sudden. 			Boom. They're all dead. I still 			got the shakes but, Jesus, 			someone's going to make a believer 			out of me. 
[40]			Just get me outta here. 
[41]			An actor. Definitely. 
[42]			Goddamn gas. My lungs are killing 			me. 	He crosses to an overhead bin. 
[43]			We got any pain killers? 
[44]			Hello, Trinity. 
[45]			He had an accident. 
[46]			You know, for a long time, I 			thought I was in love with you, 			Trinity. I used to dream about 			you. . . 	He nuzzles his face against hers, feeling the softness of 	it. 
[47]			You are a beautiful woman. Too 			bad things had to work out like 			this. 	We INTERCUT BETWEEN the appliance store and the main 	deck. 
[48]			In a way you're very lucky. Most 			people never know why they die. 			One minute they're alive, the next 			they're dead. No warning. 			Nothing. That's why I thought 			maybe I should tell you. It 			seemed the least I could do. 	He stands over the body of Morpheus, as his anger boils 	up out of him.

[50]			Zion? Zion is a part of this 			delusion. More of this madness. 			That's why this has to be done. 			It has to end. Now and forever. 	She suddenly sees the entire dark plan. 
[51]			You see, Trinity, we humans have a 			place in the future. But it's not 			here. It's in the Matrix. 
[52]			Oh, I disagree, Trinity. I 			disagree. I think the Matrix is 			more real than this world. I 			mean, all I do is pull a plug 			here. But there, you watch a man 			die. 	He grabs hold of the cable in Apoc's neck, twists it and 	yanks it out. 
[53]			You tell me which is more real. 	Apoc seems to go blind for an instant, a scream caught in 	his throat, his hands reaching for nothing, and then 	falls dead. Switch screams. 
[54]			Welcome to the real world, right? 	He laughs.

scenes.location: Utility closet/bedroom within the Matrix
scenes.description: Neo wakes up from a deep sleep, feeling better, and begins to examine his body which is connected to a futuristic IV. He is wearing a black tank top and shorts, and notices a large outlet at the base of his skull. The room is dark, and he is stretched out on his bed.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: A man who has recently been awakened within the Matrix and is discovering his new reality.
characters.position: Sitting up on his bed, examining the IV in his forearm and the outlet at the base of his skull.
characters.states: Confused, curious, and slightly alarmed.

characters.name: Morpheus
characters.description: A leader and mentor within the resistance, who has a calm and collected demeanor.
characters.position: Sitting in a chair in the far corner of the room, observing Neo.
characters.states: Serene and watchful.

actions.action: Removes the futuristic IV from his forearm and examines the outlet at the base of his skull.
actions.dialogue: What are you doing? Why do my eyes hurt?

actions.action: Opens the door and enters the room, then sits down in a chair, watching Neo.
actions.dialogue: I told you I don't believe in fate.

scenes.plot: After awakening, Neo starts to question his reality and Morpheus, who has been observing him, hints at the deeper implications of their existence within the Matrix.
