[128]			The agents. They're sentient 			programs. They can commandeer any 			software hardwired to the 			mainframe. 
[129]			The best hacking is always 			traceless. 	Cypher and Trinity move away from them, securing the 	perimeter. As Cypher passes a garbage can, he 	surreptitiously drops something inside. 	It is a cellular phone and we watch the blue display as 	the LINE CONNECTS. 	An early 1970s, black Lincoln Continental emerges from a 	corrugated roll-up garage. Morpheus and Neo get in. 
[130]			What -- what happened? 
[131]			There is no spoon. Right. 	He concentrates. The spoon begins to bend just as the 	Priestess touches his shoulder. 
[132]			Hello? 	A DISTANT FEMALE VOICE calls to him and he follows it up 	the stairs. At the top of the dais, he smells something 	cooking. 	Following the scent, he moves behind the pillars where he 	finds an open door. 
[133]			Hello? 
[134]			You're the Oracle? 
[135]			Yeah. 
[136]			What vase? 	He turns to look around and his elbow knocks a VASE from 	the table. It BREAKS against the linoleum floor. 
[137]			Shit, I'm sorry. 	She pulls out a tray of chocolate chip cookies and turns. 	She is an older woman, wearing big oven mitts, 	comfortable slacks and a print blouse. She looks like 	someone's grandma. 
[138]			How did you know. . . ? 	She sets the cookie tray on a wooden hot-pad. 
[139]			Who? 
[140]			I think so. 
[141]			I don't know. 	She gestures to a wooden plaque, the kind every grandma 	has, except that the words are in Latin. 
[142]			What's the good news? 
[143]			Is that it, then? 
[144]			You do? 
[145]			Whoa.

scenes.location: A building's rooftop in the city
scenes.description: The scene is one of chaos and urgency as the characters attempt to escape from Agents. The weather is intense with the sound of whistling metal and the roar of an exploding helicopter in the background.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: The protagonist, a cyber-athlete turned savior of humanity, with exceptional reflexes and martial arts abilities.
characters.position: Perched on the edge of the building, ready to act
characters.states: Determined, alert, and slightly injured from previous encounters

characters.name: Trinity
characters.description: A skilled hacker and fighter, loyal to the cause and to Neo.
characters.position: In the helicopter, trying to maintain control
characters.states: Anxious, focused, and ready to take drastic measures

characters.name: Morpheus
characters.description: A wise and respected leader, currently in peril.
characters.position: Hanging from a rope attached to the helicopter
characters.states: Weak, injured, and dependent on Neo's rescue

actions.action: Neo whips out his gun and presses it to the cable, ultimately snapping it and sending him and Morpheus on a perilous ascent.
actions.dialogue: None

actions.action: Trinity struggles to control the helicopter, which is riddled with bullets and leaking oil, eventually leading her to throw it towards a building.
actions.dialogue: None

actions.action: Morpheus, injured and weak, is dependent on Neo's quick thinking and actions to save him from falling to his death.
actions.dialogue: None

scenes.plot: The scene involves a daring escape attempt by Neo and his allies. It highlights the characters' resourcefulness, courage, and the high stakes they face within the Matrix.

chunk.text:
Deja vu. 	Those words stop the others dead in their tracks. 
[146]			Nothing. Just had a little deja 			vu. 
[147]			A black cat went past us and then 			I saw another that looked just 			like it. 
[148]			It might have been. I'm not sure. 	Trinity looks at Morpheus, who listens quietly to the 	rasping breath of the old building. 
[149]			What is it? 
[150]			I don't know. It just went dead. 	Trinity listens to the dead line and takes out the 	cellular. 
[151]			It's Tank! He's alive. 	Cypher lunges for Neo's plug just as Tank BLOWS his head 	off. 
[152]			Yeah. Right. 
[153]			What are they doing to him? 
[154]			How? 
[155]			How much time? 
[156]			The access codes to Zion. 
[157]			You need help. I'm coming with 			you. 
[158]			Morpheus did what he did because 			he believed that I'm something 			that I'm not. 
[159]			I'm not the One, Trinity. The 			Oracle told me. 	Trinity is stunned. 
[160]			She said I had a gift but I still 			had a lot to learn. She told me 			maybe next life. 
[161]			Why? It wouldn't mean anything. 			He'd still believe what he wanted 			to believe. But Morpheus is the 			one that matters. He's more 			important than me and we both know 			it. 	He straps in. 
[162]			I may not be what Morpheus thinks 			I am, but if I don't try to help 			him, then I'm not even what I 			think I am. 
[163]			His friend. 
[164]			Yeah? 	He snap cocks an Uzi. 
[165]			That's why it's going to work. 
[166]			There is no spoon. 	Neo whips out his gun and presses it to the cable, lower 	than where they attached themselves. 	BOOM! The CABLE SNAPS. 	The counter-weights plummet, yanking Trinity and Neo up 	through the shaft as --  	The elevator falls away beneath them, distending space, 	filling it with the sound of WHISTLING METAL as they soar 	to the top. 
[167]			Trinity! 	Agent Jones charges. 
[168]			. . . help. 	His GUN BOOMS as we enter the liquid space of --  	Bullet-time. 	The AIR SIZZLES with wads of lead-like angry flies as Neo 	twists, bends, ducks just between them. 	Agent Jones still running, narrows the gap, the BULLETS 	coming faster until --  	Neo bent impossibly back, one hand on the ground as a 	spiraling gray ball shears open his shoulder. 	He starts to scream as another digs a red groove across 	his thigh. 	He has only time to look up, to see the barrel when Agent 	Jones, standing over him, pulls the TRIGGER the final 	time. 	CLICK. Empty. 	Neo rolls, reaching for another gun when around-house 	kick snaps his jaw. Agent Jones grabs the gun and levels 	it at Neo. 
[169]			Thanks. 
[170]			I'm fine. 	Neo is already looking at the helicopter. 
[171]			Can you fly that thing? 
[172]			Get up, Morpheus! Get up! 	Morpheus sits unmoving, his head still down. 	Neo grabs the climbing rope just as marines burst into 	the adjoining room. 	He attaches only one end to his harness when they OPEN 
[173]			He won't make it. 	Morpheus lunges, out of control --  	As Neo spins, every move a whip crack --  	Snapping the other rope-end onto a bolted bar. 	Morpheus begins to fall when Neo hurls himself into the 	wide blue empty space --  	Flying for a moment. 	The rope snaking out behind him; an umbilical cord 	attached to a machine. 	As their two bodies, set in motion, rushing at each other 	on a seemingly magnetic course until --  	They collide. 	Almost bouncing free of each other, arms, legs, 	scrambling, hands searching in furious desperation, 	finding hold and clinging. 	Until the line ends, snapping taut, cracking their 	fragile embrace. Morpheus tumbles, legs flipping over, 	falling down --  	The ground deliriously distant --  	As Neo snatches hold of his mentor's still handcuffed 	wrist. 
[174]			Gotcha! 	Trinity is already pulling the copter up and away. 	As Agent Smith grabs the M-16 from the nearest marine. 	He'll bring them all down. Targeting the helicopter, he 	aims at something only he can see: the oil line. 	PONK. PONK. PONK. The rear HULL is PUNCHED full of 	holes and smoke and oil pours out like black blood. 
[175]			Oh fuck. 	Trinity throws the helicopter towards the roof of the 	nearest building. 	Morpheus and Neo cling to one another as they and the 	machine above them begin to fall. 	The ENGINE GRINDS, the CHOPPING BLADES start to slow 	while --  	The Agents stand in the open shattered window, watching 	the helicopter disappear behind taller buildings. 	Carried by its nomentum, Trinity guides the parabolic 	fall over the nearest roof where --  	Neo and Morpheus drop safely, rolling free as the rope 	goes slack. Neo gets to his feet, trying to detach 	himself but --  	The helicopter is falling too fast, arcing over the roof 	like a setting sun --  	The coils of slack snap taught --  	Yanking Neo off his feet, dragging him with ferocious 	speed towards the edge even as --  	Trinity lunges for the back door, her gun in one hand, 	grabbing for the rope with the other --  	Neo flies like a skipping stone, hurtling straight AT us, 	when his feet hit the rain gutter --  	A fulcrum that levers him up just as --  	Trinity FIRES, severing the cord from the HELICOPTER, 	falling free of it as it SMASHES, blades first into a 	glass skyscraper. 	Holding onto the rope she swings, connected to Neo, who 	stands on the building's edge watching her arc beneath 	him as the HELICOPTER EXPLODES --  	She bounces against a shatterproof window that spider- 	cracks out while FLAMES ERUPT behind her. 
[176]			Morpheus, I know you won't believe 			me but the Oracle told ne I'm not 			the One. 
[177]			Don't! 	The Old Man stops, Neo rushes at hin, gliding smoothly 	over the turnstiles. 
[178]			Get outta here. Okay? Run! Go!

scenes.event: Conflict between Neo and Agent Smith
scenes.location: An urban cave and the subway tunnel
scenes.description: A intense scene where Neo faces off against Agent Smith, involving a chase and a fight in a subway tunnel, ending with a dramatic escape.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: The protagonist, a man with the ability to manipulate the Matrix, wearing a long black coat and dark glasses.
characters.position: Initially in the urban cave, then in the subway tunnel, and finally outside the subway car.
characters.states: Initially calm, then engaged in a fierce battle, and finally exhausted but victorious.

characters.name: Agent Smith
characters.description: A sentient program designed to keep order within the Matrix, wearing a suit and sunglasses.
characters.position: Chasing Neo through the urban cave, engaging in combat in the subway tunnel, and pursuing Neo out of the subway car.
characters.states: Persistent and relentless, showing no sign of fatigue or defeat until the end of the scene.

actions.action: Neo evades Agent Smith in the urban cave and engages in hand-to-hand combat with him in the subway tunnel.
actions.dialogue: No dialogue is exchanged between Neo and Agent Smith during their confrontation.

actions.action: Agent Smith chases Neo through the subway tunnel and attacks him with a series of blows.
actions.dialogue: Agent Smith does not speak during the chase and fight.

scenes.plot: The scene involves Neo's escape from Agent Smith in a high-octane chase and fight sequence, showcasing Neo's abilities and determination.

chunk.text:
The Old Man nods, turns and hurries deeper into the urban 	cave, disappearing into the shadows as Trinity and 	Morpheus arrive. 
[179]			It was nobody. 	Neo turns to the RINGING BOOTH. 
[180]			Let's go! You first, Morpheus. 	Morpheus gets in and answers the phone. 	Lost in the shadow, the Old Man turns back and watches as 	Morpheus disappears, the phone dropping, dangling by its 	cord. 	His eyes grow wide, glowing white in the dark. 
[181]			I believe. . . 	He stares at the fullness of her lips. 
[182]			I want to kiss you. 	She smiles. 
[183]			So are you. 	The smile falls. Agent Smith yanks his TRIGGER. 
[184]			I already have. 	He attacks with a vicious series of blows but the Agent 	seems to absorb them, waiting for his opening. 	And this time Agent Smith's attack is too much, an 	unrelenting fury, fists pounding like jackhammers. 
[185]			My name is Neo. 	Impossibly, he hurls himself straight up, smashing Smith 	against the concrete ceiling of the tunnel. 	They fall as the sound and fury of the TRAIN EXPLODES 	INTO the station. 	Neo back-flips up off the tracks just as --  	The train barrels over Agent Smith. 	Neo stands, knees shaking, when the train slams on its 	emergency brake. With an ear-splitting SHRIEK of 	TORTURED RAILS, the train slows, part of it still in the 	station. 	Neo turns, limping, starting to run, racing for the 	escalator --  	As the train comes to a stop and the doors of the last 	car open; Agent Smith bursts out in furious pursuit, his 	glasses again intact. 
[186]			Mr. Wizard, Get me the fuck out 			of here! 
[187]			Hurry, Tank! I got some serious 			pursuit! 
[188]			I'm trying, Trinity. I'm trying. 
[189]			Hi. It's me. I know you're out 			there. I know you're working as 			fast as you can to catch me. 	We CLOSE IN ON the racing columns of numbers shimmering 	across the screen. 
[190]			I thought I should call and let 			you know how things stand. 	We DIVE THROUGH the numbers, surging UP THROUGH the 	darkness, sucked TOWARDS a tight constellation of stars. 
[191]			I know you're real proud of this 			world you've built, the way it 			works, all the nice little rules 			and such, but I've got some bad 			news. 	We realize that the constellation is actually the holes 	in the mouthpiece of a phone. Seen from inside. 
[192]			I've decided to make a few 			changes. 	We SHOOT THROUGH the holes as Neo hangs up the phone. 	He steps out of the phone booth and starts walking, 	wearing a long black coat and dark glasses. He passes a 	mother dragging her little BOY, who cranes his neck as --  	Neo takes off, flying up into the air. ",
        "Cypher": "
[1]			Let's see. Target left work at 
[2]			He caught the northbound Howard 			line. Got off at Sheridan. 			Stopped at 7-11. Purchased six- 			pack of beer and a box of Captain 			Crunch. Returned home. 	The area code is identified. The first three numbers 	suddenly fixed, leaving only seven flowing columns. 	We begin MOVING TOWARD the screen, CLOSING IN as each 	digit is matched, one by one, snapping into place like 	the wheels of a slot machine. 
[3]			Do you know when we're going to 			make contact? 
[4]			Just between you and me, you don't 			believe it, do you? You don't 			believe this guy is the one? 
[5]			I know. But what about you? 
[6]			Yeah, but if he's wrong --  	The final number pops into place --  
[7]			Hear what? 
[8]			Yeah, course I'm sure. 	We MOVE STILL CLOSER, the ELECTRIC HUM of the green 	numbers GROWING INTO an OMINOUS ROAR. 
[9]			Yeah. Right. See you on the other side. 	She hangs up as we PASS THROUGH the numbers, entering the 	netherworld of the computer screen. 	Where gradually the sound of a police radio grows around 	us. 
[10]			Shit. 
[11]			Morpheus, I know what you believe 			but I think this is a mistake. 			We're rushing him. He's old. I'm 			afraid he might pop. 
[12]			I knew it, I knew it. . . 
[13]			He's gonna pop! 
[14]			He's going to pop! 	Vomiting violently, Neo pitches forward and blacks out. 
[15]			Everyone falls, right, Trinity? 	But Trinity has left. 	Neo's eyes open as Tank eases the plug out. He tries to 	move and groans, cradling his ribs. 	While Tank helps Morpheus, Neo spits blood into his hand. 
[16]			Whoa! Shit, Neo, you scared the 			bejeezus out of ne. 
[17]			No, it's all right. 
[18]			Midnight watch. 	Neo's eyes light up as he steps closer to the screens 	that seem alive with a constant flow of data. 
[19]			The Matrix? Yeah. 	The monitors are packed with bizarre codes and equations. 
[20]			You want a drink? 	He pours Neo a drink from a large plastic jug. 
[21]			I'll tell you, I feel for you, 			man. I really do. Most of us 			were still young, just punks, when 			Morpheus jacked us. But you, you 			had a real life. 	Neo takes a sip and it almost kills him. Cypher pounds 	on his back. 
[22]			Good shit, huh? Dozer makes it. 			It's good for two things: 			degreasing engines and killing 			brain cells. 	Red-faced, Neo finally stops coughing. 
[23]			Did he tell you why he did it? 	Neo nods. 
[24]			I'll be the didn't tell you that 			this wasn't the first time he 			thought he found the One. 	Neo shakes his head as Cypher fills his cup and laughs. 
[25]			Let me give you a piece of advice.

scenes.location: An office
scenes.description: Neo meets Morpheus for the first time and is given a choice between the red and blue pills.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: A man who has been searching for the truth about the Matrix.
characters.position: Sitting across from Morpheus in the office.
characters.states: Curious, unsure

characters.name: Morpheus
characters.description: A leader and mentor figure who offers Neo the truth about the Matrix.
characters.position: Sitting across from Neo in the office.
characters.states: Confident, persuasive

actions.action: Offers Neo the red and blue pills, explaining their significance.
actions.dialogue: This is your last chance. After this, there is no going back. You take the blue pill and the story ends. You wake in your bed and you believe whatever you want to believe. You take the red pill and you stay in Wonderland and I show you how deep the rabbit-hole goes.

actions.action: Takes the red pill, committing to learning the truth.
actions.dialogue: Neo opens his mouth and swallows the red pill.

scenes.plot: Neo is introduced to Morpheus, who gives him a choice to either continue living in ignorance or to learn the truth about the Matrix. Neo chooses the truth and takes the red pill.

chunk.text:
The agents enter Neo's empty cubicle. A cop is sent to 	search the bathroom. 	Morpheus' voice is a whisper in Neo's ear. 
[17]			A little longer. . . 	Brown is talking to the tall employee. 
[18]			When I tell you, go to the end of 			the row to the first office on the 			left, stay. as low as you can. 	Sweat trickles down his forehead. 
[19]			Now. 	Neo rolls out of the cubicle, his eyes popping as he 	freezes right behind a cop who has just turned around. 	Staying crouched, he sneaks away, down the row, SHOOTING 	across the opening to the first office on the left. 	The room is empty. 
[20]			Good. Now there is a window. 			Open it. 
[21]			The answer is coming, Neo. 	He opens the window. The window howls into the room. 
[22]			Outside, there's a scaffold. You 			can use it to get to the roof. 	Leaning out the window, he sees that the scaffold is 	several offices away. 
[23]			There's a small ledge. It's a 			short climb. You can make it. 	Neo looks down; the building's glass wall vertigos into a 	concrete chasm. 
[24]			Don't be controlled by your fear, 			Neo. There are only two ways out 			of this building. One is that 			scaffold. The other is in their 			custody. You take a chance either 			way. I leave it to you. 	CLICK. He hangs up. Neo looks at the door, then back at 	the scaffold. 
[25]			This line is tapped, so I must be 			brief. 
[26]			They got to you first, but they've 			underestimated how important you 			are. If they knew what I know, 			you would probably be dead. 	Neo feels sick. 
[27]			I don't know what you are thinking 			right now but I want you to 			understand that I will not give up 			on you until you give up on me. 	Neo's throat cracks, dry as the Sahara. 
[28]			Do you still want to meet? 
[29]			Take the Howard line south. 	CLICK. He closes his eyes, unsure of what he has done. 
[30]			At last. 	He wears a long black coat and his eyes are invisible 	behind circular mirrored glasses. 	He strides to Neo and they shake hands. 
[31]			Welcome, Neo. As you no doubt 			have guessed, I am Morpheus. 
[32]			Please. Come. Sit. 	He nods to Trinity. 
[33]			Thank you, Trinity. 	She bows her head sharply and exits through a door to an 	adjacent room. 	They sit across from one another in cracked, burgundy- 	leather chairs. 
[34]			I imagine, right now, you must be 			feeling a bit like Alice, tumbling 			down the rabbit hole? 
[35]			I can see it in your eyes. You 			have the look of a man who accepts 			what he sees because he is 			expecting to wake up. 	A smile, razor-thin, curls the corner of his lips. 
[36]			Ironically, this is not far from 			the truth. But I'm getting ahead 			of myself. Can you tell me, Neo, 			why are you here? 
[37]			Yes. Thank you. But I think we 			both know there's more to it than 			that. Do you believe in fate, Neo? 
[38]			Why not? 
[39]			I know exactly what you mean. 	Again, that smile that could cut glass. 
[40]			Let me tell you why you are here. 			You are here because you have the 			gift. 
[41]			I've watched you, Neo. You do not 			use a computer like a tool. You 			use it like it was part of 			yourself. What you can do inside 			a computer is not normal. I know. 			I've seen it. What you do is 			magic. 	Neo shrugs. 
[42]			But it is, Neo. It is. How else 			would you describe what has been 			happening to you? 	He leans forward. 
[43]			We are trained in this world to 			accept only what is rational and 			logical. Have you ever wondered 			why? 	Neo shakes his head. 
[44]			As children, we do not separate 			the possible from the impossible 			which is why the younger a mind is 			the easier it is to free while a 			mind like yours can be very 			difficult. 
[45]			From the Matrix. 	Neo locks at his eyes but only sees a reflection of 	himself. 
[46]			Do you want to know what it is, 			Neo? 	Neo swallows and nods his head. 
[47]			It's that feeling you have had all 			your life. That feeling that 			something was wrong with the 			world. You don't know what it is 			but it's there, like a splinter in 			your mind, driving you mad, 			driving you to me. But what is 			it? 	The LEATHER CREAKS as he leans back. 
[48]			The Matrix is everywhere, it's all 			around us, here even in this room. 			You can see it out your window, or 			on your television. You feel it 			when you go to work, or go to 			church or pay your taxes. It is 			the world that has been pulled 			over your eyes to blind you from 			the truth. 
[49]			That you are a slave, Neo. That 			you, like everyone else, was born 			into bondage. . . 			. . . kept inside a prison that you 			cannot smell, taste, or touch. A 			prison for your mind. 	Outside, the WIND BATTERS a loose PANE of glass. 
[50]			Unfortunately, no one can be told 			what the Matrix is. You have to 			see it for yourself. 
[51]			Hold out your hands. 	In Neo's right hand, Morpheus drops a red pill. 
[52]			This is your last chance. After 			this, there is no going back. 	In his left, a blue pill. 
[53]			You take the blue pill and the 			story ends. You wake in your bed 			and you believe whatever you want 			to believe. 	The pills in his open hands are reflected in the glasses. 
[54]			You take the red pill and you stay 			in Wonderland and I show you how 			deep the rabbit-hole goes. 	Neo feels the smooth skin of the capsules, with the 	moisture growing in his palms. 
[55]			Remember that all I am offering is 			the truth. Nothing more. 	Neo opens his mouth and swallows the red pill. The 	Cheshire smile returns. 
[56]			Follow me. 	He leads Neo into the other room, which is cramped with 	high-tech equipment, glowing ash-bliie and electric green 	from the racks of monitors. 	Trinity, Apoc and Cypher look up as they enter. 
[57]			Haven't I always told you, Cypher, 			not to let fear control your life. 			Apoc, are we on-line? 	Neo recognizes the large man from the El train. 
[58]			Neo, time is always against us. 			Will you take a seat there? 	In the center of the room sits a chair. Near the chair 	is an old oval dressing mirror that is cracked. 
[59]			I imagine you know sonething about 			virtual reality. 	Neo sits and Trinity begins gently fixing white electrode 	disks to his head, arns, and the back of his neck. 
[60]			Tell me about it. 
[61]			If the virtual reality apparatus, 			as you called it, was wired to all 			of your senses and controlled them 			completely, would you be able to 			tell the difference between the 			virtual world and the real world? 
[62]			No, you wouldn't. 	Neo whispers to Trinity. 
[63]			The pill you took is part of a 			trace program. It's going to make 			things feel a bit strange. 	Distantly, through the ear phones, he hears Apoc POUNDING 	on a KEYBOARD. Sweat beads his face. His eyes blink and 	twitch when he notices the mirror. 	Wide-eyed he stares as it begins to heal itself, a 	webwork of cracks that slowly run together as though the 	mirror were becoming liquid. 
[64]			Just relax, Neo. 	The strands thin like rubber cement as he pulls away, 	until the fragile wisps of mirror thread break. 	With the TINKLING of GLASS, shimmering snowflakes 	of electric-blinking mercury fall, hit the ground, and 	fade. 	He looks at his hand; fingers distended into mirrored 	icicles that begin to melt rapidly, dripping, running 	like wax down his fingers, spreading across his palms 	where he sees his face reflected. 
[65]			Apoc? 
[66]			Tank, we're going to need the 			signal soon. Stay calm, Neo. 	The mirror gel seems to come to life, racing, crawling up 	his arns like hundreds of insects. 
[67]			Shit! Apoc? 	Streams of mercury run from Neo's nose. 
[68]			Now, Tank now!

scenes.location: An upscale restaurant atop a skyscraper in the heart of the city
scenes.description: The restaurant boasts a stunning view with an atmosphere of elegance and mystery. The lighting is dim, and the air is thick with anticipation as the characters meet.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: The protagonist of the Matrix, known for his exceptional abilities and his role as the chosen one.
characters.position: Seated at a corner table, gazing out at the cityscape.
characters.states: Reflective, yet alert and ready for action.

characters.name: Morpheus
characters.description: A wise and respected leader of the resistance, known for his insight and determination.
characters.position: Standing near the window, his silhouette outlined against the setting sun.
characters.states: Serene, yet commanding as he prepares to discuss important matters with Neo.

actions.action: Neo sips his drink thoughtfully, his eyes never leaving the view outside. He seems to be contemplating his next move.
actions.dialogue: I've been thinking about what you said, Morpheus. About choice. I think I'm starting to understand.

actions.action: Morpheus turns to face Neo, his expression serious yet hopeful.
actions.dialogue: Understanding is the first step towards true freedom, Neo. But it's just the beginning of the journey.

scenes.plot: In a pivotal moment, Neo and Morpheus meet to discuss the nature of reality and the path to freedom. The air is tense with the weight of their conversation and the implications it holds for the future of the resistance.

chunk.text:
Between you and me, if Morpheus 			says you can fly, I wouldn't go 			jumping out any windows to find 			out if he's right. Understand? 	Cypher raises his drink. Neo swallows another throat- 	scorching mouthful. 
[26]			Welcome to the real world!

That's why I thought 			maybe I should tell you. It 			seemed the least I could do. 	He stands over the body of Morpheus, as his anger boils 	up out of him.

actions.dialogue: Real is just another four-letter word.

scenes.location: A nightclub, with loud music and a crowd of people
scenes.description: Tank is on the ground, and the sights of a plasma rifle are mentioned. The atmosphere is tense, with a sense of urgency and danger.

characters.name: Tank

characters.position: On the ground, possibly injured or in a defensive position
characters.states: Alert, possibly in a state of readiness or concern

characters.name: Agent Smith
characters.description: A sentient program within the Matrix, an agent of the system
characters.position: Standing over Tank, possibly in a dominant or threatening posture
characters.states: Calm and collected, yet potentially dangerous

characters.name: Trinity
characters.description: A key member of the resistance, with a significant role in the narrative
characters.position: Close to Neo, possibly guiding or protecting him
characters.states: Urgent, yet composed, as she delivers critical information

actions.action: Agent Smith recovers his ear piece and stands over Tank, possibly preparing to take action
actions.dialogue: None, his actions speak of a potential threat

actions.action: Trinity approaches Neo, speaking to him in a low voice, warning him of the danger
actions.dialogue: She tells Neo that he is in a lot of danger and that they are watching him

scenes.plot: The scene sets up a confrontation between Tank and Agent Smith, with Trinity providing critical information to Neo, hinting at the larger plot involving the Matrix and the resistance.

chunk.text:
He rolls over and finds Tank on the ground, and 	the sights of the plasma rifle. ",
        "Brown": "
[1]			Where are they? 
[2]			Perhaps we are asking the wrong 			questions. 
[3]			How? 
[4]			What were you doing? 	Agent Smith recovers, replacing his ear piece. 
[5]			They are actually attacking. 
[6]			The trace was completed. 
[7]			The extermination unit is in 			place. 
[8]			He's gone. 	Agent Smith smiles, standing over him. ",
        "Trinity": "
[1] 
[2]			All right, you're relieved. Use 			the usual exit. 
[3]			Soon. 	Only two thin digits left. 
[4]			I think Morpheus believes he is. 
[5]			I think Morpheus knows things that 			I don't. 
[6]			Did you hear that? 
[7]			Are you sure this line is clean? 
[8]			I better go. 
[9]			Shit. 
[10]			Morpheus! The link was traced! I 			don't know how. 
[11]			Are there any agents? 
[12]			Goddamnit! 
[13]			All right --  
[14]			Get up, Trinity. You're fine. 			Get up -- just get up! 	She stands and limps down the rest of the stairs. 
[15]			Hello, Neo. 
[16]			I know a lot about you. I've been 			wanting to meet you for some time. 
[17]			My name is Trinity. 
[18]			That was a long time ago. 
[19]			What? 
[20]			Most guys do. 	Neo is a little embarrassed. 
[21]			No. It's safe here and I don't 			have much time. 	The MUSIC is so loud they must stand very close, talking 	directly into each other's ear. 
[22]			I had to gamble that you would see 			and they wouldn't. 
[23]			I can't explain everything to you. 			I'm sure that it's all going to 			seem very strange, but I brought 			you here to warn you, Neo. You 			are in a lot of danger. 
[24]			They're watching you. Something 			happened and they found out about 			you. Normally, if our target is 			exposed we let it go. But this 			time, we can't do that. 
[25]			You came here because you wanted 			to know the answer to a hacker's 			question. 
[26]			Twelve years ago I met a man, a 			great man, who said that no one 			could be told the answer to that 			question. That they had to see 			it, to believe it. 	Her body is against his; her lips very close to his ear. 
[27]			He told me that no one should look 			for the answer unless they have to 			because once you see it, 			everything changes. Your life and 			the world you live in will never 			be the same. It's as if you wake 			up one morning and the sky is 			falling. 	There is a hypnotic quality to her voice and Neo feels 	the words like a drug, seeping into him. 
[28]			The truth is out there, Neo. It's 			looking for you and it will find 			you, if you want it to. 	She takes hold of him with her eyes. 
[29]			That's all I can tell you right 			now. Good-bye, Neo. And good 			luck. 
[30]			You know who. 	She turns and he watches her melt into the shifting wall 	of bodies. 	A SOUND RISES steadily, growing out of the music, 	pressing in on Neo until it is all he can hear as we --  
[31]			Shit. 
[32]			We got him. Call the chop-shop. 	She hangs up. 
[33]			Listen to me, Neo. You have to, 			trust us. 	She tears off a long strip of black duct-tape and reaches 	for his face. 
[34]			This has to be done for your 			protection and ours. 	She seals his eyes shut with the tape. 
[35]			You can't understand right now, 			but if you're not one of us, 			you're one of them. 
[36]			Hello, Gizmo. 	Neo hears the voices around him. 
[37]			Yeah. 
[38]			Are you going to help us or aren't 			you? 
[39]			We think you're bugged. We can't 			take you to Morpheus until you're 			clean. 
[40]			What's happening? 
[41]			Do something! 
[42]			Are you crazy? That will kill 			him. 	We watch Neo, who can't see what they are talking about. 
[43]			Clear. 
[44]			Neo, are you okay? 	He nods. 
[45]			It's over. We got it. 	Hanging from the claw pick is the inanimate metal wire- 	tap. 
[46]			Thanks for your help, Gizmo. 
[47]			Gizmo, you don't have the hardware 			to handle this software. 	He howls with adolescent laughter as the van pulls away. 	Trinity turns to Neo. 
[48]			Let's go. He's waiting. 
[49]			This is it. 	Neo can hear his own heart pounding. 
[50]			Let me give one piece of advice. 			Be honest. He knows more than you 			can possibly imagine. 
[51]			I knew he would. 	Cypher saddles up to Morpheus, talking in a hushed tone 	away from, Neo. 
[52]			It's going into replication. 
[53]			I got a fibrillation! 
[54]			He's going into arrest! 
[55]			Far from it.

scenes.location: An old lobby, near the doors
scenes.description: The atmosphere is tense as the characters prepare for an emergency evacuation. The sound of helicopter blades grows louder, indicating the approach of danger.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: The protagonist, a man with the potential to be 'The One'.
characters.position: Standing near the doors with Switch and Apoc, awaiting instructions.
characters.states: Alert and ready for action.

characters.name: Trinity
characters.description: A skilled crew member and Neo's love interest.
characters.position: Close to Neo, preparing for the worst.
characters.states: Anxious and focused on the task at hand.

characters.name: Cypher
characters.description: A traitor within the group, responsible for the current danger.
characters.position: Away from the group, having just hung up the phone after making a deal.
characters.states: Calm and calculating, having just committed an act of betrayal.

actions.action: Neo answers the phone when there is a click, only to find silence. He is then told about the accident and the potential loss of Dozer.
actions.dialogue: What happened? Where's Tank? An accident? What about Dozer? Is Dozer there?

actions.action: Trinity yells at Cypher, expressing her anger and determination to fight.
actions.dialogue: Goddamn you, Cypher! We should hurry. Tank, you're hurt.

actions.action: Cypher walks away from Morpheus and bends down next to Apoc's body, having just given away their location for personal gain.
actions.dialogue: The Matrix isn't real! Somehow, some way, you're going to pay for this.

scenes.plot: The scene involves a rescue attempt amidst a growing threat. The characters are dealing with the betrayal of Cypher, the injury of Tank, and the impending danger that is drawing closer with the sound of the helicopter blades.

[56]			Easy, Neo. Easy. 	Dozer holds him while Trinity unlocks it. Once it's out, 	he tears away from them, falling as he trips free of the 	harness. 
[57]			Come on. 
[58]			Neo, I saved you some dinner --  	She sees him passed out on the bed. She sets the tray 	down and pulls the blanket over him. 	She pauses, her face close to his, then inhales lightly, 	breathing in the scent of him, before slowly pulling away. 	It seems the moment she closes the door, he wakes with a 	start, unsure of where he is. After a moment, he gets 	out of bed. 
[59]			Yeah. 
[60]			Lots of things. 
[61]			Some of them. 
[62]			There's no point in worrylng. 			Whatever is going to happen is 			going to happen. 	They cross the old lobby. Switch and Apoc stop at the 	doors. 
[63]			Here they come. 
[64]			What did you just say? 
[65]			What happened? What did you see? 
[66]			How much like it? Was it the same 			cat? 
[67]			A deja vu is usually a glitch in 			the Matrix. It happens when they 			change something. 	She also listens as the staccato BEAT of HELICOPTER 	BLADES GROW ominously LOUDER. 
[68]			Oh, God. 
[69]			They'll be able to track it. 
[70]			Morpheus, don't --  
[71]			We need a phone. 
[72]			Tank, it's me. 
[73]			We need an exit! 
[74]			Cypher, I thought --  
[75]			Got it. 	She hangs up. 
[76]			You first,. Neo. 	Neo answers the phone when there is a CLICK. There is no 	signal. Nothing but silence. 
[77]			What happened? 
[78]			Cypher? Where's Tank? 
[79]			An accident? What about Dozer? 			Is Dozer there? 
[80]			You killed them. 
[81]			What about Zion? 
[82]			Oh rny God. This is abzut Zion. 			You gave them Morpheus for the 			access codes to Zion. 	Cypher walks away from Morpheus and bends down next to 	Apoc's body. 
[83]			The Matrix isn't real! 
[84]			Somehow, some way, you're going to 			pay for this. 
[85]			Goddamn you, Cypher! 
[86]			We should, we should hurry. 
[87]			Tank, you're hurt. 
[88]			Dozer? 	Tank's face tightens. 
[89]			I'm sorry, Tank. 
[90]			Goddamnit! Goddamnit! 
[91]			No! 
[92]			I'm going in after him. 
[93]			If he does I'm sure you'll do what 			has to be done. 
[94]			No. No, I don't think you do. If 			you did, then you would know that 			I'm not letting him go. Not 			without a fight, Tank. 	She yanks her harness tight. 
[95]			Not without a fight. 
[96]			What do you think you're doing? 
[97]			No. No way. Morpheus sacrificed 			himself so you could escape. 			There's no way you're going back 			in. 
[98]			What? 
[99]			Did you tell Morpheus? 
[100]			What are you? 
[101]			Guns. Lots of guns. 
[102]			No one has ever done anything like 			this. 
[103]			Dodge this, motherfucker! 	BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! The body flies back with a flash of 	mercurial light and when it hits the ground --  	It is the pilot. 	Trinity helps Neo up. 
[104]			You're hit --  
[105]			Not yet. 	She pulls out a cellular phone. 
[106]			Tank, I need a pilot program for a 			military M-109 helicopter. 	Tank is immediately searching the disk drawers. 
[107]			Hurry! 	His fingers flash over the gleaming laser disks, finding 	one that he feeds into Trinityls supplement drive, 	punching the "load" cormands on her keyboard. 
[108]			Let's go.

She hears him SCREAM and sees Agent Smith emerge as if 	formed by congealing darkness, charging with a fistful of 	metal. 	The GUN FIRES, the BULLET flying at her, BURSTING through 	the plastic WINDOW just as --  	Trinity disappears. 	The handset hanging in the air as the BULLET HITS, 	SHATTERING the EAR-PIECE.

scenes.plot: A high-octane chase scene where Neo is hunted by Agents Brown and Smith, with Neo narrowly avoiding a deadly collision.

chunk.text:
[20]			The Oracle. 	Neo looks down at the monitor teeming with Matrix data 	that seems to coalesce, equations giving way to images as 	a METAL SCREAM RISES BECOMING --   
[21]			Weird. This area never has this 			much activity. 
[22]			They're on their way. 
[23]			Oh, shit! Oh, shit! 
[24]			It's a trap! 
[25]			They cut the hard-line! It's a 			trap! Get out! 	Cable yanks open the curtain. 
[26]			No, no, no. 
[27]			Got it. 
[28]			Now left and that's it in front of 			you. 
[29]			Nerve gas. 
[30]			No! 
[31]			We gotta find the others. They're 			still alive. 	The PHONE RINGS. 
[32]			Operator. 
[33]			Cypher? I thought they had you? 
[34]			I got you. 
[35]			Nearest exit is Franklin and Erie. 			An old appliance store. 	Cypher hangs up and smiles as the fire trucks arrive. 
[36]			Operator. 
[37]			Gotcha. You're not far from 			Cypher. 
[38]			So did we. That boy's got nine 			lives. I sent him to Franklin and 			Erie. 
[39]			Got him. 	Cypher's body twitches in its harness, jerking itself 	awake. His eyes blink open. Dozer unplugs him. 
[40]			How's it feel, Cypher? Knowing 			you're about to die? 
[41]			I'll be all right. 
[42]			They're cracking his mind. 
[43]			They inject virus-like serums to 			break down the system. It's like 			cracking a computer. All it takes 			is time. 
[44]			Depends on the mind. But 			eventually, it will crack and his 			alpha pattern will change from 			this to this. 	Tank punches several commands on Morpheus' personal unit. 	The monitor waves change from a chaotic pattern to an 	orderly symmetrical one. 
[45]			When it does, Morpheus will tell 			them anything they want to know. 
[46]			If an agent got inside Zion's 			mainframe he could do anything. 			Disable the defense system. It 			would be the end of us. 	He looks up at Trinity who is pacing relentlessly. 
[47]			We can't let that happen. We have 			to do it, Trinity. Zion has to be 			protected. 	Trinity sees Cypher's dead body. Rage overtakes her and 	she starts kicking hin. 
[48]			We have to pull the plug. 
[49]			We don't have any other choice. 	Those words are like using gasoline to put out a fire and 	we watch the pain in her eyes burn into a blaze. She 	walks past him and gets into her chair. 
[50]			Trinity, what are you doing? 
[51]			Morpheus could conform at any 			minute --  
[52]			You saw that place. It's suicide. 	She glares at him. 
[53]			I know what Morpheus means to 			you --  
[54]			Okay. Store's open. What do you 			need? 
[55]			Coming right up. 	He loads the weapons disk. 
[56]			Hold on, Morpheus. They're coming 			for you. They're coming. 
[57]			Operator. 
[58]			He's the One. He's got to be. . . 
[59]			Got one ready. An underground El 			station. State and Balbo. 
[60]			See ya soon. 
[61]			What the hell just happened? 
[62]			I can't! 
[63]			I'm looking, Trinity! I'm 			looking! 	From the cockpit, an ALARM sounds. Morpheus hurries to 	the front console, typing, bringing up the radar. 	Trinity follows him. 
[64]			Operator. 
[65]			I got one! 	Neo glances to his right and sees Agent Brown, now 	driving the car beside his. Agent Brown swerves, 	slamming into him. 
[66]			Wabash and Lake. A hotel. 	Neo fights the steering wheel as Agent Brown pushes the 	car up over the median. 
[67]			Room 303. 	Neo drops the phone as his car bucks into the opposing 	lane --  	Directly into the charging path of an enormous truck 	driven by Agent Smith. 	Neo dives from the Mercedes as the truck plows into it, 	rending metal and GLASS, crushing through, totaling other 	cars, as it EXPLODES. 	Neo is up and running even as orange and black clouds 	billow up behind hin. 
[68]			I'm going to make the call. 
[69]			Almost there. "
    }
}

scenes.event: The Encounter with the Mysterious Guide
scenes.location: A quiet park; under a willow tree
scenes.description: A serene scene where the protagonist meets a mysterious guide, amidst a gentle breeze and the rustling of leaves.

characters.name: Luke
characters.description: The protagonist, a young adventurer, is curious and eager to learn about his destiny.
characters.position: Sitting on a bench near the willow tree, gazing into the distance.
characters.states: Reflective and attentive.

characters.name: Mentor
characters.description: A wise and enigmatic figure who is about to impart valuable insights to Luke.
characters.position: Standing beside the willow tree, with a serene expression.
characters.states: Calm and slightly mysterious.

actions.action: The Mentor approaches Luke and engages him in conversation, hinting at the journey that lies ahead.
actions.dialogue: Ah, Luke, I've been expecting you. There's much you need to learn about your path. The journey is just beginning.

actions.action: Luke listens intently, responding with a mix of confusion and excitement.
actions.dialogue: I'm ready to learn, Mentor. Please guide me on this path.

scenes.plot: This scene introduces Luke to his mentor, who is set to provide guidance and unlock the mysteries of Luke's destiny, setting the stage for his upcoming journey.

chunk.text:
[123]			You can't use that until Neo is 			out! 
[124]			Neo, you better get your ass back 			here! 
[125]			Where is he? 
[126]			Hurry, Neo. 
[127]			No-no-no! Neo, you're not dead! 			You can't be dead! 
[128]			You're right here. I'm holding 			you, Neo. I'm not letting you go. 			Do you hear me? I won't let you 			go. 
[129]			Goddamnit, Neo! Don't give it up! 			Not now! 	She pounds on his chest. 
[130]			Not now! 
[131]			Now get up! 
[132]			Now! 	He turns the key. 
[133]			Neo? 	His eyes open. Tears pour from her smiling eyes as he 	reaches up to touch her. 	And she kisses hin; it seems like it might last forever. ",
        "Oracle": "
[1] 	It looks like a suburban tract house. 	There is a lot of cozy furniture, a dining roon hutch 	filled with china, shelves and tables crowded with 	doilies, knick-knacks and ceramic brick-a-brack. 	Neo follows the plastic carpet runner to the kitchen. 	A WOMAN is huddled beside the oven, peering inside 	through the cracked door. 
[2]			I know. You're Neo. Be right 			with you. 
[3]			Bingo. I got to say I love seeing 			you non-believers. It's really a 			relief. All that pomp and 			circumstances just plain tucker me 			out. Almost done. Smell good, 			don't they? 
[4]			I'd ask you to sit down, but 			you're not going to anyway. And 			don't worry about the vase. 
[5]			The vase. 
[6]			I said don't worry about it. I'll 			get one of my kids to fix it. 
[7]			What's really going to bake your 			noodle later on is, would you 			still have broken it if I hadn't 			said anything. 	Smiling, she lights a cigarette. 
[8]			You're cuter than I thought. I 			see why she likes you. 
[9]			Not too bright, though. 	She winks. 
[10]			You know why Morpheus brought you 			to see me? 
[11]			So? What do you think? You think 			you're the one? 
[12]			You know what that means? It's 			Latin. Means, 'Know thyself. '  	She puts her cigarette down. 
[13]			Well, let's have a look at you. 	She widens his eyes, checks his ears, then feels the 	glands in his neck. 
[14]			Open your mouth. Say, 'ahhh. '  	She nods then looks at his palms. 
[15]			Hmmm. You sure got the gift, but 			it's tricky. I'd say the bad news 			is, you're not the one. Still got 			a lot to learn. Maybe next life. 
[16]			Same as the bad news, you're not 			the one. 
[17]			No. Here. 	She picks up the tray of cooling cookies. 
[18]			You better take a cookie. Got a 			big day ahead of you. 	He eyes her, then takes a cookie. 
[19]			Make a believer out of you yet. ",
        "Jones": "
[1]			Their next target. The name is 			Neo. 	The handset of the pay phone lays on the ground, 	separated in the crash like a severed limb. 
[2]			It's already begun. 	We are SUCKED TOWARDS the mouthpiece of the phone, CLOSER 	and CLOSER, UNTIL the smooth gray plastic spreads out 	like a horizon and the small HOLES WIDEN until we fall 	through one --  	Swallowed by the darkness that becomes --  	A computer screen. 	We are on-line, inside a chat room called "The Matrix. " 	It is an exklusive web-site where hackers hang out. 
[3]			The others were lost. 
[4]			There is a problem. Reagan has 			failed to secure the hardware. 	Agent Smith stares out the window. 
[5]			But if Reagan has failed, why 			haven't they pulled the plug? 
[6]			Or he doesn't know. 
[7]			You don't know. 
[8]			I think they're trying to save 			him. 
[9]			Lower level --  
[10]			Only human. . . 	Suddenly Agent Jones stops. Something is wrong. He 	scans the roof. Trinity is gone. 	Immediately, he whirls around and turns straight into the 	muzzle of her . 45 --  	Jammed right into his head. 
[11]			Remain at your posts. 
[12]			You will do as you are ordered! 
[13]			We have their position. 
[14]			Order the strike. 	Agent Smith can't stand listening to them. He moves to 	the edge of the building, looking out at the surrounding 	city. ",
        "Mouse": "
[1]			Morpheus is fighting Neo! 	All at once they bolt for the door. 
[2]			You ever seen anyone that fast 			that soon, Tank? 
[3]			I don't believe it! 
[4]			No one's ever made their first 			jump. 
[5]			What does it mean? 
[6]			Welcome to Movie-Phone. 
[7]			Right. 	The phone flips shut as he jumps up. 
[8]			Let's get to work. 
[9]			Yeah. . . 	The CELLULAR RINGS. 
[10]			What's going on? ",
        "Rhineheart": "
[1]			You have a problem, Mr. Anderson. 			You think that you're special. 			You believe that somehow the rules 			do not apply to you. 	He stops, glancing over his glasses at Neo, who turns in 	time. 
[2]			Obviously, you are mistaken.

scenes.location: A suburban tract house; kitchen and dining area
scenes.description: A tense moment where characters confront each other and reveal critical information.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: The protagonist, a hacker within the Matrix, is determined and confused.
characters.position: Initially standing near the kitchen, later sitting down.
characters.states: Initially anxious, then becomes more relaxed after conversation with the Oracle.

characters.name: Oracle
characters.description: A mysterious figure who provides guidance and insights within the Matrix.
characters.position: Sitting beside the oven, later moves to the dining area.
characters.states: Warm and inviting, shows a sense of humor, and seems to enjoy the interaction with Neo.

actions.action: Offers Neo a cookie and shares cryptic insights about his destiny.
actions.dialogue: I'd ask you to sit down, but you're not going to anyway. And don't worry about the vase... You're cuter than I thought. I see why she likes you.

actions.action: Takes a cookie and listens intently to the Oracle, showing a mix of confusion and curiosity.
actions.dialogue: What's really going to bake your noodle later on is, would you still have broken it if I hadn't said anything.

actions.action: Reveals to Neo that he is not 'the one' but still has much to learn.
actions.dialogue: You sure got the gift, but it's tricky. I'd say the bad news is, you're not the one. Still got a lot to learn. Maybe next life.

scenes.plot: The scene unfolds with the Oracle providing guidance to Neo, who is seeking answers about his role in the Matrix. The Oracle reveals that he is not 'the one' but hints at his potential and the journey ahead.

scenes.location: A software company office building
scenes.description: Neo is being pursued by Agents Brown and Jones, along with a group of cops, after they discover his cubicle. Morpheus guides Neo through a series of actions to escape capture.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: A software engineer who is about to learn the truth about the Matrix.
characters.position: Hiding in an empty cubicle, then moving to an office window.
characters.states: Anxious, but following Morpheus' instructions carefully.

characters.name: Morpheus
characters.description: A leader of the resistance, guiding Neo to safety.
characters.position: Unknown, contacting Neo via phone.
characters.states: Calm and directive, providing escape instructions.

characters.name: Agents Brown and Jones
characters.description: Sentient programs in the Matrix, pursuing Neo.
characters.position: Searching Neo's cubicle and moving through the office space.
characters.states: Determinant and relentless in their pursuit.

actions.action: Hides in an empty cubicle, then sneaks to an office window.
actions.dialogue: None

actions.action: Instructs Neo over the phone on how to escape the agents.
actions.dialogue: Go to the end of the row to the first office on the left. Stay low. Now, go to the window. There's a scaffold. You can use it to get to the roof.

actions.action: Search for Neo in his cubicle and around the office.
actions.dialogue: None

scenes.plot: The scene involves Neo's narrow escape from the agents with Morpheus' guidance, highlighting the tension and the stakes involved in the world of the Matrix.

chunk.text:
His long, bony fingers resume clicking the keyboard. 
[3]			This company is one of the top 			software companies in the world 			because every single employee 			understands that they are a part 			of a whole. Thus, if an employee 			has a problem, the company has a 			problem. 	He turns again. 
[4]			The time has come to make a 			choice, Mr. Anderson. Either you 			choose to be at your desk on time 			from this day forth, or you choose 			to find yourself another job. Do 			I make myself clear? ",
        "Dozer": "
[1]			He needs a lot of work. 
[2]			There he is. 
[3]			System check looks fine. 	Cypher stands, a raspy cough spewing from his lungs. 
[4]			You okay? 
[5]			The first aid kit's over here. 	As Dozer stoops for a cabinet, Cypher pulls back a heavy 	blanket exposing a plasma rifle. 
[6]			No! 	Tank spins as red hot wads of PLASMA EXPLODE through his 	chair and into his back. Diving, a second BURST tears up 	his side --  	As Dozer shoots a look at the monitor where Tank was 	working. He stabs the enter command activating the exit 	sequence and ducks under a BARRAGE of PLASMA FIRE-   ",
        "Morpheus": "
[1]			I know. Stay calm. 
[2]			Yes. 
[3]			You have to focus. There is a 			phone. Wells and Laxe. You can 			make it. 	She takes a deep breath, centering herself. 
[4]			Go. 	She drops the phone. 
[5]			Hello, Neo. This is Morpheus. 	Neo's knees give and he falls into his chair. 
[6]			I had hoped for this conversation 			to take place under less adverse 			conditions, but you can never 			count on hope, can you, Neo? 
[7]			I've been watching you, Neo, and I 			want to meet you. I don't know if 			you're ready to see what I want to 			show you, but unfortunately, we 			have run out of time. They're 			coming for you, Neo. And I'm not 			sure what they're going to do. 
[8]			Stand up and see for yourself. 
[9]			Yes. Now. 	Neo starts to stand. 
[10]			Do it slowly. Slowly. The elevator. 	His head slowly peeks up over the partition. 	At the elevator, he sees Agent Brown and Agent Jones 	leading a group of cops. A female employee turns and 	points out Neo's cubicle. 	Neo ducks. 
[11]			Yes. 	One cop stays at the elevator, the others follow the 	agents. 
[12]			I'm not sure. But, if you don't 			want to find out, you better get 			out of there. 
[13]			I can guide you out, but you have 			to do exactly what I say. 	The agents are moving quickly towards the cubicle. 
[14]			The cubicle across from you is 			empty. 
[15]			Go! Now! 	Neo lunges across the hall, diving into the other cubicle 	just as the agents turn into his row. 	Neo crams himself into a dark corner, clutching the phone 	tightly to him. 
[16]			Stay here for a moment. 	The agents enter Neo's empty cubicle. A cop is sent to 	search the bathroom. 	Morpheus' voice is a whisper in Neo's ear. 
[17]			A little longer. . . 	Brown is talking to the tall employee. 
[18]			When I tell you, go to the end of 			the row to the first office on the 			left, stay. as low as you can. 	Sweat trickles down his forehead. 
[19]			Now. 	Neo rolls out of the cubicle, his eyes popping as he 	freezes right behind a cop who has just turned around. 	Staying crouched, he sneaks away, down the row, SHOOTING 	across the opening to the first office on the left. 	The room is empty. 
[20]			Good. Now there is a window. 			Open it. 
[21]			The answer is coming, Neo. 	He opens the window. The window howls into the room. 
[22]			Outside, there's a scaffold. You 			can use it to get to the roof. 	Leaning out the window, he sees that the scaffold is 	several offices away. 
[23]			There's a small ledge. It's a 			short climb. You can make it. 	Neo looks down; the building's glass wall vertigos into a 	concrete chasm. 
[24]			Don't be controlled by your fear, 			Neo. There are only two ways out 			of this building. One is that 			scaffold. The other is in their 			custody. You take a chance either 			way. I leave it to you. 	CLICK. He hangs up. Neo looks at the door, then back at 	the scaffold. 
[25]			This line is tapped, so I must be 			brief. 
[26]			They got to you first, but they've 			underestimated how important you 			are. If they knew what I know, 			you would probably be dead. 	Neo feels sick. 
[27]			I don't know what you are thinking 			right now but I want you to 			understand that I will not give up 			on you until you give up on me. 	Neo's throat cracks, dry as the Sahara. 
[28]			Do you still want to meet? 
[29]			Take the Howard line south. 	CLICK. He closes his eyes, unsure of what he has done. 
[30]			At last. 	He wears a long black coat and his eyes are invisible 	behind circular mirrored glasses. 	He strides to Neo and they shake hands. 
[31]			Welcome, Neo. As you no doubt 			have guessed, I am Morpheus. 
[32]			Please. Come. Sit. 	He nods to Trinity. 
[33]			Thank you, Trinity. 	She bows her head sharply and exits through a door to an 	adjacent room. 	They sit across from one another in cracked, burgundy- 	leather chairs.

scenes.location: A room within the Matrix
scenes.description: A pivotal moment where Neo is offered a choice to either take the red pill and learn the truth about the Matrix or take the blue pill and remain in ignorance.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: A computer programmer by day and a hacker by night, Neo is the protagonist of the story, known for his exceptional skills within the Matrix.
characters.position: Sitting in a chair, surrounded by high-tech equipment, with electrode disks attached to his head, arms, and neck.
characters.states: Curious, yet a bit wary of the unknown that lies ahead.

characters.name: Morpheus
characters.description: A leader and mentor within the resistance, Morpheus is known for his wisdom and strong belief in destiny.
characters.position: Standing in front of Neo, offering him the choice between the red and blue pills.
characters.states: Serious and confident, with a hint of a smile as he presents the pills to Neo.

actions.action: Holds out both pills, explaining their significance to Neo.
actions.dialogue: This is your last chance. After this, there is no going back. You take the blue pill and the story ends. You wake in your bed and you believe whatever you want to believe. You take the red pill and you stay in Wonderland and I show you how deep the rabbit-hole goes.

actions.action: Takes the red pill, signifying his desire to know the truth.
actions.dialogue: Neo opens his mouth and swallows the red pill.

scenes.plot: The scene sets the stage for Neo's awakening as he makes the choice to learn the truth about the Matrix, guided by Morpheus' mentorship.

chunk.text:
[34]			I imagine, right now, you must be 			feeling a bit like Alice, tumbling 			down the rabbit hole? 
[35]			I can see it in your eyes. You 			have the look of a man who accepts 			what he sees because he is 			expecting to wake up. 	A smile, razor-thin, curls the corner of his lips. 
[36]			Ironically, this is not far from 			the truth. But I'm getting ahead 			of myself. Can you tell me, Neo, 			why are you here? 
[37]			Yes. Thank you. But I think we 			both know there's more to it than 			that. Do you believe in fate, Neo? 
[38]			Why not? 
[39]			I know exactly what you mean. 	Again, that smile that could cut glass. 
[40]			Let me tell you why you are here. 			You are here because you have the 			gift. 
[41]			I've watched you, Neo. You do not 			use a computer like a tool. You 			use it like it was part of 			yourself. What you can do inside 			a computer is not normal. I know. 			I've seen it. What you do is 			magic. 	Neo shrugs. 
[42]			But it is, Neo. It is. How else 			would you describe what has been 			happening to you? 	He leans forward. 
[43]			We are trained in this world to 			accept only what is rational and 			logical. Have you ever wondered 			why? 	Neo shakes his head. 
[44]			As children, we do not separate 			the possible from the impossible 			which is why the younger a mind is 			the easier it is to free while a 			mind like yours can be very 			difficult. 
[45]			From the Matrix. 	Neo locks at his eyes but only sees a reflection of 	himself. 
[46]			Do you want to know what it is, 			Neo? 	Neo swallows and nods his head. 
[47]			It's that feeling you have had all 			your life. That feeling that 			something was wrong with the 			world. You don't know what it is 			but it's there, like a splinter in 			your mind, driving you mad, 			driving you to me. But what is 			it? 	The LEATHER CREAKS as he leans back. 
[48]			The Matrix is everywhere, it's all 			around us, here even in this room. 			You can see it out your window, or 			on your television. You feel it 			when you go to work, or go to 			church or pay your taxes. It is 			the world that has been pulled 			over your eyes to blind you from 			the truth. 
[49]			That you are a slave, Neo. That 			you, like everyone else, was born 			into bondage. . . 			. . . kept inside a prison that you 			cannot smell, taste, or touch. A 			prison for your mind. 	Outside, the WIND BATTERS a loose PANE of glass. 
[50]			Unfortunately, no one can be told 			what the Matrix is. You have to 			see it for yourself. 
[51]			Hold out your hands. 	In Neo's right hand, Morpheus drops a red pill. 
[52]			This is your last chance. After 			this, there is no going back. 	In his left, a blue pill. 
[53]			You take the blue pill and the 			story ends. You wake in your bed 			and you believe whatever you want 			to believe. 	The pills in his open hands are reflected in the glasses. 
[54]			You take the red pill and you stay 			in Wonderland and I show you how 			deep the rabbit-hole goes. 	Neo feels the smooth skin of the capsules, with the 	moisture growing in his palms. 
[55]			Remember that all I am offering is 			the truth. Nothing more. 	Neo opens his mouth and swallows the red pill. The 	Cheshire smile returns. 
[56]			Follow me. 	He leads Neo into the other room, which is cramped with 	high-tech equipment, glowing ash-bliie and electric green 	from the racks of monitors. 	Trinity, Apoc and Cypher look up as they enter. 
[57]			Haven't I always told you, Cypher, 			not to let fear control your life. 			Apoc, are we on-line? 	Neo recognizes the large man from the El train. 
[58]			Neo, time is always against us. 			Will you take a seat there? 	In the center of the room sits a chair. Near the chair 	is an old oval dressing mirror that is cracked. 
[59]			I imagine you know sonething about 			virtual reality. 	Neo sits and Trinity begins gently fixing white electrode 	disks to his head, arns, and the back of his neck. 
[60]			Tell me about it. 
[61]			If the virtual reality apparatus, 			as you called it, was wired to all 			of your senses and controlled them 			completely, would you be able to 			tell the difference between the 			virtual world and the real world? 
[62]			No, you wouldn't. 	Neo whispers to Trinity. 
[63]			The pill you took is part of a 			trace program. It's going to make 			things feel a bit strange. 	Distantly, through the ear phones, he hears Apoc POUNDING 	on a KEYBOARD. Sweat beads his face. His eyes blink and 	twitch when he notices the mirror. 	Wide-eyed he stares as it begins to heal itself, a 	webwork of cracks that slowly run together as though the 	mirror were becoming liquid. 
[64]			Just relax, Neo. 	The strands thin like rubber cement as he pulls away, 	until the fragile wisps of mirror thread break. 	With the TINKLING of GLASS, shimmering snowflakes 	of electric-blinking mercury fall, hit the ground, and 	fade. 	He looks at his hand; fingers distended into mirrored 	icicles that begin to melt rapidly, dripping, running 	like wax down his fingers, spreading across his palms 	where he sees his face reflected. 
[65]			Apoc? 
[66]			Tank, we're going to need the 			signal soon. Stay calm, Neo.

scenes.event: Neo's awakening and introduction to the real world
scenes.time: Unknown, presumably after the Matrix is revealed
scenes.location: The Nebuchadnezzar, a hovercraft
scenes.description: After a painful process of awakening, Neo finds himself aboard the Nebuchadnezzar. The environment is dark, cramped, and cold, with an array of bizarre electronic equipment and several crew members present.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: A man who has recently been awakened from the Matrix. He is disoriented and is being introduced to the real world.
characters.position: Sitting in an ectoskeleton chair, surrounded by electronic equipment
characters.states: Confused, in pain, and adjusting to the new reality

characters.name: Morpheus
characters.description: The leader of the Nebuchadnezzar's crew, who has taken it upon himself to awaken Neo. He is calm and authoritative.
characters.position: Standing near Neo, explaining the situation
characters.states: Calm, focused, and in control

actions.action: Morpheus touches Neo's head and guides a coaxial line into the jack at the back of his neck, connecting him to the Construct.
actions.dialogue: This will feel a little weird.

actions.action: Neo experiences a series of disturbing noises and sensations as the connection is made, ultimately resulting in a feeling of weightlessness.
actions.dialogue: None, but expressions of discomfort and surprise are evident.

scenes.plot: After a painful process, Neo is awakened to the real world by Morpheus and introduced to the Construct, a loading program where they can acquire anything they need, from clothes to training simulations.

chunk.text:
The mirror gel seems to come to life, racing, crawling up 	his arns like hundreds of insects. 
[67]			Shit! Apoc? 	Streams of mercury run from Neo's nose. 
[68]			Now, Tank now! 	His eyes tear with mirror, rolling up and closing as a 	high-pitched ELECTRIC SCREAM ERUPTS in the headphones --  	It is a piercing SHRIEK like a computer calling to 	another computer --  	Neo's body arches in agony and we are pulled like we were 	pulled into the holes of the phone  	Sucked into his SCREAM and swallowed by darkness. 
[69]			Welcome to the real world, Neo. 	Neo passes out. 
[70]			I know. 	Dozer and Morpheus are operating on Neo. 
[71]			Your muscles have atrophied. 			We're rebuilding them. 	Fluorescent light sticks burn unnaturally bright. 
[72]			You've never used them before. 	Morpheus takes his sunglasses off and puts them on Neo. 	Neo lays back. 
[73]			Rest, Neo. The answers are 			coming. 
[74]			More important than what is when? 
[75]			You believe the year is 1997 when 			in fact it is much closer to 2197. 			I can't say for certain what year 			it is because we honestly do not 			know. 	The wind is knocked from Neo's chest. 
[76]			I promised you the truth, Neo, and 			the truth is that the world you 			were living in was a lie. 
[77]			I'll show you. 
[78]			This is my ship, the 			Nebuchadnezzar. It's a 			hovercraft. Small like a 			submarine. It's dark. It's 			cramped and cold. But it's home. 	They climb a ladder up to the main deck. 
[79]			This is the main deck. You know 			most of my crew. 	Trinity smiles and nods. 
[80]			The ones you don't know. That's 			Mouse and Switch. The two big 			guys are Tank and Dozer. 	The names and faces wash meaninglessly over Neo. 
[81]			And this, this is the Core. This 			is where we broadcast our pirate 			signal and hack into the Matrix. 	It is a swamp of bizarre electronic equipment. Vines of 	coaxial hang and snake to and from huge monolithic 	battery slabs, a black portable satellite dish and banks 	of little systems and computer monitors. 	At the center of the web, there are six ectoskeleton 	chairs made of a poly-alloy frame and suspension harness. 	Near the circle of chairs is the control console and 	operator's station where the network is monitored. 
[82]			Help him, Trinity. 	Neo allows himself to be helped into one of the chairs. 
[83]			Do you remember when I asked you 			about an apparatus that could turn 			a virtual reality into reality? 	Neo nods. 
[84]			It's right here. 	He touches Neo's head. 
[85]			And it's accessed here. 	Neo feels Morpheus guiding a coaxial line into the jack 	at the back of his neck. The cable has the same kind of 	cerebellum chip we saw inside the plant. 
[86]			This will feel a little weird. 	There are several disturbing NOISES as he works the 	needle in. 	We MOVE IN as Neo's shoulders bunch and his face tightens 	into a grimace until a loud CLICK fires and his ears pop 	like when you equalize them underwater. 	He relaxes, opening his eyes as we pull back to a feeling 	of weightlessness inside another place --   
[87]			This is the Construct. 	Startled, Neo whips around and finds Morpheus now in the 	room with him. 
[88]			It is our loading program. We can 			load anything from clothes, to 			weapons, to training simulations. 			Anything we need. 	Morpheus walks past Neo and when Neo turns he sees the 	two leather chairs from the hotel set up in front of a 	large-screen television. 
[89]			Sit down. 	Neo stands at the back of the chair as Morpheus sits. 
[90]			Wild, isn't it? 	Neo's hands run over the cracked leather. 
[91]			What is real? How do you define 			real? If you're talking about 			your senses, what you feel, taste, 			smell, or see, then all you're 			talking about are electrical 			signals interpreted by your brain. 	He picks up a remote control and clicks ON the 	TELEVISION. We drift through the Windy City circa 1996. 
[92]			This is the Chicago you know. 			Chicago as it was at the end of 			the twentieth century. This 			Chicago exists only as part of a 			neural-interactive simulation that 			we call the Matrix. 	We GLIDE AT the television as he changes the channel. 
[93]			You have been living inside 			Baulliaurd's vision, inside the 			map, not the territory. This is 			Chicago as it exists today. 	The sky is an endless sea of black and green bile. The 	earth, scorched and split like burnt flesh, spreads out 	beneath us as we ENTER the television. 
[94]			'The desert of the real. '  	In the distance, we see the ruins of a future Chicago 	protruding from the wasteland like the blackened ribs of 	a long-dead corpse. 
[95]			We are, right now, miles below the 			earth's surface. The only place 			humans can survive outside the 			Matrix is underground. 	Still MOVING, we TURN and find Neo and Morpheus; the 	chairs now sitting in the middle of the black desert. 	Dizzy, Neo holds onto the chair. 
[96]			It started early in the twenty- 			first century, with the birth of 			artificial intelligence, a 			singular consciousness that 			spawned an entire race of 			machines. 	In his sunglasses, we see storm clouds gather. 
[97]			At first all they wanted was to be 			treated as equals, entitled to the 			same human inalienable rights. 			Whatever they were given, it was 			not enough. 	In the circular window of the glasses, EXPLOSIONS light 	up a bloody battle field. 
[98]			We don't know who struck first. 			Us or them. But sometime at the 			end of the twenty-first century 			the battle was joined. 	We MOVE INTO his glasses and the war surrounds us.

scenes.event: Morpheus trains Neo in martial arts
scenes.location: A dojo within the Construct
scenes.description: Morpheus is training Neo in martial arts, emphasizing the importance of freeing the mind. The dojo is a white, featureless space where they are surrounded by the Construct's simulated reality.

characters.name: Morpheus
characters.description: A wise and skilled leader of the resistance, with a serene demeanor and powerful presence.
characters.position: Stands in a fighting stance, ready to demonstrate and teach.
characters.states: Calm and focused, with a hint of a smile as he challenges Neo.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: The protagonist, a man who is learning about his destiny within the Matrix. He is determined but still learning to control his abilities.
characters.position: Initially circling Morpheus cautiously, then attacking with a fury.
characters.states: Initially confident, then frustrated and winded after being outmatched by Morpheus.

actions.action: Launches a fierce attack on Morpheus, using a variety of martial arts moves.
actions.dialogue: None, the action is described from an observer's perspective.

actions.action: Blocks every attack with ease and then counterattacks, overwhelming Neo with his skill.
actions.dialogue: None, the action is described from an observer's perspective.

scenes.plot: This scene is a pivotal moment in Neo's training, where he learns that the power of the mind is greater than physical strength within the Matrix.

chunk.text:
[99]			The war raged for generations and 			turned the face of our planet from 			green and blue to black and red. 	At last we see the Sentinels; killing machines that are 	at once terrifying and beautiful. They have an organic 	architecture like a microbiotic organism, that is 	perpetually in motion. 	The Sentinel cracks the body armor of a soldier, 	splitting open the soft, stearing meat inside. 
[100]			It scorched and burned the sky. 			Without the sun, the machines 			sought out a new energy source to 			survive. 	The Sentinel locks up, as heat lightning of black ink 	bursts against the sky, spreading into a permanent cloud 	of stain. 
[101]			They discovered a new form of 			fusion. All that was required to 			initiate the reaction was a small 			electric charge. Throughout human 			history we have been dependent on 			machines to survive. Fate, it 			seems, is not without a sense of 			irony. 	We return to the power plant that Neo escaped from where 	we see human beings looking almost blissful in their 	gelatin cocoons. 
[102]			The human body generates more bio- 			electricity than a 120-volt 			battery and over 25,000 B. T. U. 's 			of body heat. 	Outside, spreading all around the power plant, beneath a 	breathing greenhouse, are the growing fields. 
[103]			We are, as an energy source, 			easily renewable and completely 			recyclable, the dead liquified and 			fed intravenously to the living. 	Huge farm-like reapers are harvesting the crop. 
[104]			All they needed to control this 			new battery was something to 			occupy our mind. 	We see inside a clear tubular husk. Floating in viscous 	fluid, there is a human fetus; its soft skull already 	growing around the brain-jack. 
[105]			And so they built a prison out of 			our past, wired it to our brains 			and turned us into slaves. 	We PULL BACK to find the image is now on the television 	and we are again inside the white space of the Construct. 
[106]			I didn't say that it would be 			easy, Neo. I just said that it 			would be the truth. 	The room without walls begins to spin. 
[107]			No. But if you could, would you 			really want to? 	Neo isn't sure of that answer. 
[108]			I feel that I owe you an apology. 			There is a rule that we do not 			free a mind once it reaches a 			certain age. It is dangerous. 			They have trouble letting go. . 			Their mind turns against them. 			I've seen it happen. I broke the 			rule because I had to. 	He stares into the darkness, confessing as much to 	himself as Neo. 
[109]			When the Matrix was first built 			there was a man born inside that 			had the ability to change what he 			wanted, to remake the Matrix as he 			saw fit. It was this man that 			freed the first of us and taught 			us the secret of the war; control 			the Matrix and you control the 			future. 	He pauses. 
[110]			When he died, the Oracle at the 			temple of Zion prophesied his 			return and envisioned an end to 			the war and freedom for our 			people. That is why there are 			those of us that have spent our 			entire lives searching the Matrix, 			looking for him. 	Neo can feel his eyes on him. 
[111]			I did what I did, because I 			believe we have been brought here 			for a reason, Neo. You are here 			to serve a purpose, just as I am 			here to serve mine. 
[112]			But I do, Neo. I do. 	He stands up. 
[113]			Get some rest. You're going to 			need it. 
[114]			Your training. 
[115]			How is he? 	Tank looks at his watch, rubs his eyes. 
[116]			Show me. 
[117]			This is a sparring program, 			similar to the programmed reality 			of the Matrix. Consider this your 			first lesson. 	He assumes a fighting stance. 
[118]			Attack me. 	Neo assumes a similar stance, cautiously circling until 	he gives a short cry and launches a furious attack. 	It is like a Jackie Chan movie at high speed, fists and 	feet striking from every angle as Neo presses his attack 	--  	But each and every blow is blocked by effortless speed. 
[119]			Good. Adaption. Improvisation. 			But your weakness isn't your 			technique. 	Morpheus attacks him and it is like nothing we have seen. 	His feet and fists are everywhere taking Neo apart. For 	every blow Neo blocks, five more hit their marks until --  	Neo falls. 	Panting, on his hands and knees, blood spits fror, his 	mouth speckling the white floor of the Dojo. 
[120]			How did I beat you? 
[121]			Do you think my being faster, 			stronger has anything to do with 			my muscles in this place? 	Neo is frustrated, still unable to catch his breath. 
[122]			Do you believe that's air you are 			breathing now? 	Neo squints at him. 
[123]			If you can free your mind, the 			body will follow. 	Neo stands, nodding. 
[124]			Again. 	Their fists fly with  pneumatic speed. 
[125]			You are angry with me. 	Neo pants. 
[126]			It's all right. It's natural. 
[127]			Good, good. Anger is a gift, Neo, 			but it's a heavy one. 	Morpheus smiles. 
[128]			Tank, load the jump program. 	Neo straightens as the dojo DISSOLVES away like a curtain 	lifting, leaving the two men now standing on a building 	rooftop in a city skyline. 
[129]			You have to learn to let go of 			that anger. You must let go of 			everything. 	A WIND HOWLS, whipping Morpheus' long coat to the side. 
[130]			You must empty yourself to free 			your mind. 	Morpheus spins, running hard at the edge of the rooftop. 	And jumps.

scenes.location: A training room within the Nebuchadnezzar
scenes.description: A scene where Neo is undergoing combat training with Tank as his operator. The environment is a virtual simulation inside the Matrix, with various equipment and monitors surrounding them.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: A young man with a troubled expression, wearing a training suit. He is the protagonist and is known as 'The One'.
characters.position: Standing in the center of the training room, surrounded by simulation equipment.
characters.states: Concentrated, determined, and a bit overwhelmed by the training.

characters.name: Tank
characters.description: A confident and enthusiastic operator, wearing a casual outfit. He is excited about Neo's potential.
characters.position: Sitting at the operator's chair, flipping through a carousel of micro discs.
characters.states: Engaged, supportive, and a bit impatient to see Neo's abilities.

actions.action: Offers his hand to Neo and introduces himself as Tank, the operator. He explains that he and his brother Dozer are pure humans, born free in Zion.
actions.dialogue: Morning. Did you sleep? You will tonight. I guarantee it. I'm Tank. I'll be your operator.

actions.action: Shakes Tank's hand and takes a moment to observe that Tank doesn't have any jacks.
actions.dialogue: N/A

actions.action: Suggests they start with combat training, showing Neo a disk labeled 'sore combat training'.
actions.dialogue: How about sore combat training?

actions.action: Reads the label on the disk and seems intrigued but also a bit wary.
actions.dialogue: N/A

scenes.plot: The scene sets up Neo's training with Tank, establishing their relationship and the beginning of Neo's journey to understand his potential within the Matrix.

chunk.text:
He sails through the air, his coat billowing 	out behind him like a cape --  	Somersaults once and lands on the rooftop across the 	street. 
[131]			Everyone falls the first time. 	Neo nods quietly. 
[132]			If you never know failure, how can 			you know success? 
[133]			The body cannot live without the 			mind. 
[134]			How's he doing? 
[135]			Good. I want everyone alerted to 			12-hour stand-by. We're going in. 			Neo, it's time for you to know why 			you're here. 	Morpheus walks away. 
[136]			We're in. 	He hangs up. 
[137]			Mouse and Cable hold the exit. 			Let's go. 
[138]			We should be back in an hour. 
[139]			Do you now understand what it 			means when we say, if you're not 			one of us, you're one of them? 
[140]			Anyone that is still in a power 			plant. That is why we try to be 			invisible in the Matrix. 
[141]			You're looking well, Mojo. 	Mojo coughs a brown, cankerous laugh, juice speckling his 	chin and shirt. He stares at Neo.
